quote: You can't catch trout with dry breeches.
author: Spanish proverb

quote: I don't think about risks much. I just do what I want to do. If you gotta go  you gotta go.
author: Lillian Carter

quote: Behold the turtle. He makes progress only when he sticks his neck out.
author: James Bryant Conant

quote: Nothing ventured  nothing gained.
author: Anonymous

quote: Don't be afraid to take a big step if one is indicated. You can't cross a chasm in two small steps.
author: David Lloyd George

quote: There is little place in the political scheme of things for an independent  creative personality  for a fighter. Anyone who takes that role must pay a price.
author: Shirley Chisholm

quote: Take calculated risks. That is quite different from being rash.
author: General George S. Patton

quote: Valour lies just halfway between rashness and cowardice.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: I compensate for big risks by always doing my homework and being well-prepared. I can take on larger risks by reducing the overall risk.
author: Donna E. Shalala

quote: Accept that all of us can be hurt  that all of us can-and surely will at times-fail. Other vulnerabilities  like being embarrassed or risking love  can be terrifying  too. I think we should follow a simple rule: if we can take the worst  take the risk.
author: Dr. Joyce Brothers

quote: Every man has the right to risk his own life in order to preserve it. Has it ever been said that a man who throws himself out the window to escape a fire is guilty of suicide?
author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

quote: Courage is rarely reckless or foolish ... courage usually involves a highly realistic estimate of the odds that must be faced.
author: Margaret Truman

quote: You can no more win a war than you can win an earthquake.
author: Jeannette Rankin

quote: It is the risk element which ensures security. Risk brings out the ingenuity and resourcefulness which ensure success.
author: Robert Rawls

quote: Entrepreneurs  in accepting risk  achieve security for all. In embracing change  they ensure social and economic stability.
author: George Gilder

quote: Those who cling to life die  and those who defy death live.
author: Uyesugi Kenshin

quote: And the trouble is  if you don't risk anything  you risk even more.
author: Erica Jong

quote: Danger can never by overcome without taking risks.
author: Latin proverb

quote: The rewards go to the risk-takers  those who are willing to put their egos on the line and reach out to other people and to a richer  fuller life for themselves.
author: Susan RoAne

quote: Every minute of life I take a risk  it's part of the enjoyment.
author: Otto Preminger

quote: Everything is sweetened by risk.
author: Alexander Smith

quote: My favorite thing is to go where I have never gone.
author: Diane Arbus

quote: The power of habit and the charm of novelty are the two adverse forces which explain the follies of mankind.
author: Maria De Beausacq

quote: The soul should always stand ajar  ready to welcome the ecstatic experience.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: Adventure is worthwhile in itself.
author: Amelia Earhart

quote: We may by our excessive prudence squeeze out of the life we are guarding so anxiously all the adventurous quality that makes it worth living.
author: Randolph Bourne

quote: A dreamer-you know-it's a mind that looks over the edges of things.
author: Mary O'Hara

quote: I feel very adventurous. There are so many doors to be opened  and I'm not afraid to look behind them.
author: Elizabeth Taylor

quote: Danger and delight grow on one stalk.
author: English proverb

quote: Life has no romance without risk.
author: Sarah Doherty

quote: The moment somebody says "this is very risky" is the moment it becomes attractive to me.
author: Kate Capshaw

quote: One can never consent to creep when one feels an impulse to soar.
author: Helen Keller

quote: Prudence keeps life safe  but does not often make it happy.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Between two evils  I always picked the one I never tried before.
author: Mae West

quote: Life is either always a tightrope or a feather bed. Give me the tightrope.
author: Edith Wharton

quote: The greater the difficulty  the more glory in surmounting it.
author: Epicurus

quote: Victories that are cheap are cheap. Those only are worth having which come as the result of hard fighting.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: The greater the obstacle  the more glory in overcoming it.
author: Moliere

quote: People who are born even-tempered  placid and untroubled-secure from violent passions or temptations to evil-those who have never needed to struggle all night with the angel to emerge lame but victorious at dawn  never become great saints.
author: Eva Le Gallienne

quote: The harder the conflict  the more glorious the triumph. What we obtain too cheaply  we esteem too lightly  'tis dearness only that gives everything its value.
author: Thomas Paine

quote: The fiery trials through which we pass will light us down in honor or dishonor to the last generation.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: To conquer without risk is to triumph without glory.
author: Pierre Corneille

quote: There could be no honor in a sure success  but much might be wrested from a sure defeat.
author: T. E. Lawrence

quote: The follies which a man regrets most in his life are those which he didn't commit when he had the opportunity.
author: Helen Rowland

quote: There is no memory with less satisfaction than the memory of some temptation we resisted.
author: James Branch Cabell

quote: The only things one never regrets are one's mistakes.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: The only things you regret are the things you don't do.
author: Michael Curtiz

quote: The defense force inside of us wants us to be cautious  to stay away from anything as intense as a new kind of action. Its job is to protect us  and it categorically avoids anything resembling danger. But it's often wrong.
author: Barbara Sher

quote: For of all sad words of tongues or pen the saddest are these: It might have been.
author: John Greenleaf Whittier

quote: Calculation never made a hero.
author: John Henry Cardinal Newman

quote: To play it safe is not to play.
author: Robert Altman

quote: Better hazard once than always be in fear.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: No one would have crossed the ocean if he could have gotten off the ship in the storm.
author: Charles F. Kettering

quote: Nine times out of ten the best thing that can happen to a young man is to be tossed overboard and compelled to sink or swim.
author: James A. Garfield

quote: Life is either a daring adventure or nothing.
author: Helen Keller

quote: When something does not insist on being noticed  when we aren't grabbed by the collar or struck on the skull by a presence or an event  we take for granted the very things that most deserve our gratitude.
author: Cynthia Ozick

quote: There are those who have discovered that fear is death in life  and have willingly risked physical death and loss of all that is considered valuable in order to live in freedom.
author: Virginia Burden Tower

quote: I tore myself away from the safe comfort of certainties through my love for truth  and truth rewarded me.
author: Sylvia Ashton-Warner

quote: In danger there is great power.
author: Agnes Whistling Elk

quote: Why not go out on a limb? Isn't that where the fruit is?
author: Frank Scully

quote: You might as well fall flat on your face as lean over too far backward.
author: James Thurber

quote: Defensive strategy never has produced ultimate victory.
author: General Douglas MacArthur

quote: We stand now where two roads diverge. But unlike the roads in Robert Frost's familiar poem  they are not equally fair. The road we have long been traveling is deceptively easy  a smooth superhighway on which we progress with great speed  but at its end lies disaster. The other fork of the road-the one less traveled by-offers our last  our only chance to reach a destination that assures the preservation of the earth.
author: Rachel Carson

quote: To gain that which is worth having  it may be necessary to lose everything else.
author: Bernadette Devlin

quote: We fail far more often by timidity than by over-daring.
author: David Grayson

quote: Nothing can resist a will which will stake even existence upon its fulfillment.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: Risk always brings its own rewards: the exhilaration of breaking through  of getting to the other side  the relief of a conflict healed  the clarity when a paradox dissolves.
author: Marilyn Ferguson

quote: No guts  no glory.
author: Anonymous

quote: Sometimes I think we can tell how important it is to risk by how dangerous it is to do so.
author: Sonia Johnson

quote: He gets a good hold on the paintbrush  then confidently has the ladder removed.
author: Roger Vaughan

quote: Speaking of Ted Turner The important thing is this: to be able at any moment to sacrifice what we are for what we could become.
author: Charles Du Bos

quote: Better that we should die fighting than be outraged and dishonored. Better to die than to live in slavery.
author: Emmeline Pankhurst

quote: The fixed determination to have acquired the warrior soul  to either conquer or perish with honor  is the secret of victory.
author: General George S. Patton

quote: If man is not ready to risk his life  where is his dignity?
author: Andre Malraux

quote: All serious daring starts from within.
author: Eudora Welty

quote: To avoid an occasion for our virtues is a worse degree of failure than to push forward pluckily and make a fall.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: Risk! Risk anything! ... Do the hardest thing on earth for you. Act for yourself. Face the truth.
author: Katherine Mansfield

quote: Living at risk is jumping off the cliff and building your wings on the way down.
author: Ray Bradbury

quote: We owe something to extravagance  for thrift and adventure seldom go hand in hand.
author: Jennie Jerome Churchill

quote: There was never a place for her in the ranks of the terrible  slow army of the cautious. She ran ahead  where there were no paths.
author: Dorothy Parker

quote: I prefer liberty with danger to peace with slavery.
author: The Palatine of Posnan

quote: Do not follow where the path may lead. Go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.
author: Muriel Strode

quote: Be wary of the man who urges an action in which he himself incurs no risk.
author: Joaquin Setanti

quote: Creativity is inventing  experimenting  growing  taking risks  breaking rules  making mistakes  and having fun.
author: Mary Lou Cook

quote: Necessity is the mother of taking chances.
author: Mark Twain

quote: I am one of those people who can't help getting a kick out of life-even when it's a kick in the teeth.
author: Polly Adler

quote: Something must be left to chance  nothing is sure in a sea fight beyond all others.
author: Horatio Nelson

quote: You do not have to be superhuman to do what you believe in.
author: Debbi Fields

quote: We can only do what is possible for us to do. But still it is good to know what the impossible is.
author: Maria Irene Fornes

quote: I love the challenge.
author: Nancy Lopez

quote: We must dare  and dare again  and go on daring.
author: Georges Jacques Danton

quote: Into the darkness they go  the wise and the lovely.
author: Edna Saint Vincent Millay

quote: Dare to be naive.
author: R. Buckminster Fuller

quote: My playground was the theatre. I'd sit and watch my mother pretend for a living. As a young girl  that's pretty seductive.
author: Gwyneth Paltrow

quote: What you teach your own children is what you really believe in.
author: Cathy Warner Weatherford

quote: Nothing arouses ambition so much as the trumpet clang of another's fame.
author: Baltasar Gracian

quote: I studied the lives of great men and famous women  and I found that the men and women who got to the top were those who did the jobs they had in hand  with everything they had of energy and enthusiasm and hard work.
author: Harry S. Truman

quote: It's true that heroes are inspiring  but mustn't they also do some rescuing if they are to be worthy of their name? Would Wonder Woman matter if she only sent commiserating telegrams to the distressed?
author: Jeanette Winterson

quote: I believe in recovery  and I believe that as a role model I have the responsibility to let young people know that you can make a mistake and come back from it.
author: Ann Richards

quote: People never improve unless they look to some standard or example higher and better than themselves.
author: Tyron Edwards

quote: My heart is happy  my mind is free. I had a father who talked with me.
author: Hilde Bigelow

quote: If a child is too keep alive his inborn sense of wonder ... he needs the companionship of at least one adult who can share it  rediscovering with him the joy  excitement  and mystery of the world we live in.
author: Rachel Carson

quote: Examine the personality of the mother  who is the medium through which the primitive infant transforms herself into a socialized human being.
author: Beata Rank

quote: That some should be rich shows that others may become rich  and hence is just encouragement to industry and enterprise.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: The best teachers of humanity are the lives of great men.
author: Charles H. Fowler

quote: As it is our nature to be more moved by hope than fear  the example of one we see abundantly rewarded cheers and encourages us far more than the sight of many who have not been well treated disquiets us.
author: Francesco Guicciardini

quote: Keep away from people who try to belittle your ambitions. Small people always do that  but the really great make you feel that you  too  can become great.
author: Mark Twain

quote: To be ignorant of the lives of the most celebrated men of antiquity is to continue in a state of childhood.
author: Plutarch

quote: People seldom improve when they have no other model but themselves to copy.
author: Oliver Goldsmith

quote: As you get older it is harder to have heroes  but it is sort of necessary.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: The most important single influence in the life of a person is another person ... who is worthy of emulation.
author: Paul D. Shafer

quote: Lives of great men all remind us we can make our lives sublime  and  departing  leave behind us  footprints on the sands of time.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Very few men are wise by their own counsel  or learned by their own teaching. For he that was only taught by himself had a fool for his master.
author: Ben Johnson

quote: Call the roll in your memory of conspicuously successful business giants and ... you will be struck by the fact that almost every one of them encountered inordinate difficulties sufficient to crush all but the gamest of spirits. Edison went hungry many times before he became famous.
author: B. C. Forbes

quote: Without heroes  we are all plain people  and don't know how far we can go.
author: Bernard Malamud

quote: If you can't be a good example  then you'll just have to be a horrible warning.
author: Catherine Aird

quote: A good example is the best sermon.
author: Anonymous

quote: Children have more need of models than of critics.
author: Carolyn Coats

quote: Kill reverence and you've killed the hero in man.
author: Ayn Rand

quote: We deceive ourselves when we fancy that only weakness needs support. Strength needs it far more.
author: Anne-Sophie Swetchine

quote: Example has more followers than reason.
author: Christian Bovee

quote: Example moves the world more than doctrine.
author: Henry Miller

quote: Example is the school of mankind  and they will learn at no other.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: Example is not the main thing in influencing others. It is the only thing.
author: Albert Schweitzer

quote: We travel to learn  and I have never been in any country where they did not do something better than we do it  think some thoughts better than we think  catch some inspiration from heights above our own.
author: Maria Mitchell

quote: Judgment can be acquired only by acute observation  by actual experience in the school of life  by ceaseless alertness to learn from others  by study of the activities of men who have made notable marks  by striving to analyze the everyday play of causes and effects  by constant study of human nature.
author: B. C. Forbes

quote: We need to teach the next generation of children from day one that they are responsible for their lives.
author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross

quote: When you are a mother  you are never really alone in your thoughts ... A mother has to think twice  once for herself and once for her child.
author: Sophia Loren

quote: Our mothers and our grandmothers  some of them: moving to music not yet written.
author: Alice Walker

quote: Nothing is so infectious as example.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quote: There is a need for heroism in American life today.
author: Agnes Meyer

quote: One filled with joy preaches without preaching.
author: Mother Teresa

quote: There is a difference between imitating a good man and counterfeiting him.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Imitation is for shirkers  like-minded-ness for the comfort lovers  unifying for the creators.
author: Mary Parker Follett

quote: Each of us is in fact what he is almost exclusively by virtue of his imitative-ness.
author: William James

quote: Go to the ant  thou sluggard  learn to live  and by her busy ways  reform thy own.
author: Elizabeth Smart

quote: Imitation is a necessity of human nature.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: When people are free to do as they please  they usually imitate each other.
author: Eric Hoffer

quote: Whatever good I have accomplished as an actress I believe came in direct proportion to my efforts to portray black women who have made positive contributions to my heritage.
author: Cicely Tyson

quote: Emulation is a noble and just passion  full of appreciation.
author: J. C. F. von Schiller

quote: Emulation admires and strives to imitate great actions  envy is only moved to malice.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: Tis no shame to follow the better precedent.
author: Ben Johnson

quote: Imitation can acquire pretty much everything but the power which created the thing imitated.
author: Henry S. Haskins

quote: Almost all absurdity of conduct arises from the imitation of those whom we cannot resemble.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: To do exactly as your neighbors do is the only sensible rule.
author: Emily Post

quote: From the errors of others  a wise man corrects his own.
author: Publilius Syrus

quote: Learn from the mistakes of others- you can't live long enough to make them all yourself.
author: Martin Vanbee

quote: Wise men learn by other men's mistakes  fools by their own.
author: H. G. Bohn

quote: A man is fortunate if he encounters living examples of vice  as well as of virtue  to inspire him.
author: Brendan Francis

quote: Learn to see in another's calamity the ills which you should avoid.
author: Publilius Syrus

quote: Don't use the conduct of a fool as a precedent.
author: Talmud

quote: A prudent person profits from personal experience  a wise one from the experience of others.
author: Dr. Joseph Collins

quote: Is there anyone so wise as to learn by the experience of others?
author: Voltaire

quote: If ... you can't be a good example  then you'll just have to be a horrible warning.
author: Catherine Aird

quote: If you want to be loved  be lovable.
author: Ovid

quote: Man loves little and often  woman much and rarely.
author: Anonymous

quote: The first sigh of love is the last of wisdom.
author: Antoine Bret

quote: Love is an ocean of emotions  entirely surrounded by expenses.
author: Lord Dewar

quote: If you would be loved  love and be lovable.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: The magic of first love is our ignorance that it can ever end.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: Immature love says "I love you because I need you." Mature love says "I need you because I love you."
author: Erich Fromm

author: Erich Fromm

quote: All roads lead to Rome  but our antagonists think we should choose different paths.
author: Jean de la Fontaine

quote: The grandeur that was Rome.
author: Edgar Allan Poe

quote: Rome was not built in a day.
author: Anonymous

quote: The king reigns but does not govern.
author: Otto von Bismarck

quote: That the king can do no wrong is a necessary and fundamental principle of the English constitution.
author: Sir William Blackstone

quote: Every noble crown is  and on Earth will forever be  a crown of thorns.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: The trappings of a monarchy would set up an ordinary commonwealth.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: I am the State.
author: Louis XIV

quote: The King is dead! Long live the King!
author: Pardoe

quote: Put not your trust in princes.
author: Bible

quote: Uneasy lies the head that wears a crown.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Ay  every inch a king.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Nations have passed away and left no traces  And history gives the naked cause of it - One single simple reason in all cases  They fell because their peoples were not fit.
author: Rudyard Kipling

quote: So in the Libyan fable it is told That once an eagle  stricken with a dart  Said  when he saw the fashion of the shaft  'With our own feathers  not by others' hands  Are we now smitten.'
author: Aeschylus

quote: No man is demolished but by himself.
author: Thomas Bentley

quote: What does not destroy me  makes me strong.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: I never was ruined but twice - once when I lost a lawsuit  and once when I gained one.
author: Voltaire

quote: All men that are ruined are ruined on the side of their natural propensities.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: My downfall raises me to infinite heights.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: Candour and generosity  unless tempered by due moderation  lead to ruin.
author: Tacitus

quote: Italians come to ruin most generally in three ways - women  gambling and farming. My family chose the slowest one.
author: Pope John

quote: "They say so" is half a lie.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: I cannot tell how the truth may be  I say the tale as 'twas said to me.
author: Walter Scott

quote: What some invent the rest enlarge.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: God blessed the seventh day  and sanctified it: because that in it he had rested from all his work which God created and made.
author: Bible

quote: Day of the Lord  as all our days should be!
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: The Sabbath was made for man  and not man for the Sabbath.
author: Anonymous

quote: What makes old age so sad is not that our joys but our hopes cease.
author: Jean Paul Richter

quote: No sadder proof can be given by a man of his own littleness  than disbelief in great men.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: No one is more profoundly sad than he who laughs too much.
author: Jean Paul Richter

quote: Nothing is more sad than the death of an illusion.
author: Arthur Koestler

quote: A feeling of sadness and longing that is not akin to pain  and resembles sorrow only as the mist resembles the rain.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Reminiscences make one feel so deliciously aged and sad.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Poverty makes you sad as well as wise.
author: Bertolt Brecht

quote: Sadness is a state of sin.
author: Andre Gide

quote: Sadness and gladness succeed each other.
author: Anonymous

quote: Proud people breed sad sorrows for themselves.
author: Emily Bronte

quote: It is sad to grow old but nice to ripen.
author: Brigitte Bardot

quote: Sadness flies on the wings of the morning  and out of the heart of darkness comes the light.
author: Jean Giraudoux

quote: Sadness flies away on the wings of time.
author: Jean de la Fontaine

quote: Never let go of that fiery sadness called desire.
author: Patti Smith

quote: Sadness is almost never anything but a form of fatigue.
author: Andre Gide

quote: Sadness flies away on the wings of time.
author: Jean de la Fontaine

quote: Never let go of that fiery sadness called desire.
author: Patti Smith

quote: Sadness is almost never anything but a form of fatigue.
author: Andre Gide

quote: What makes old age so sad is not that our joys but our hopes cease.
author: Jean Paul Richter

quote: No sadder proof can be given by a man of his own littleness  than disbelief in great men.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: No one is more profoundly sad than he who laughs too much.
author: Jean Paul Richter

quote: Nothing is more sad than the death of an illusion.
author: Arthur Koestler

quote: A feeling of sadness and longing that is not akin to pain  and resembles sorrow only as the mist resembles the rain.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Reminiscences make one feel so deliciously aged and sad.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Poverty makes you sad as well as wise.
author: Bertolt Brecht

quote: Sadness is a state of sin.
author: Andre Gide

quote: Sadness and gladness succeed each other.
author: Anonymous

quote: Proud people breed sad sorrows for themselves.
author: Emily Bronte

quote: It is sad to grow old but nice to ripen.
author: Brigitte Bardot

quote: It is better to be safe than sorry.
author: American Proverb

quote: The trodden path is the safest.
author: Legal maxim

quote: They that go down to the sea in ships  that do business in great waters  these see the works of the Lord  and his wonders in the deep.
author: Bible

quote: The wind that blows  the ship that goes And the lass that loves a sailor.
author: Old English Toast

quote: The principle of procrastinated rape is said to be the ruling one in all the great bestsellers.
author: V. S. Pritchett

quote: The structure of a play is always the story of how the birds came home to roost.
author: Arthur Miller

quote: One is healthy when one can laugh at the earnestness and zeal with which one has been hypnotized by any single detail of one's life.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: When we remember that we are all mad  the mysteries disappear and life stands explained.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Madness is part of all of us  all the time  and it comes and goes  waxes and wanes.
author: Otto Friedrich

quote: A man should not strive to eliminate his complexes  but to get into accord with them: they are legitimately what directs his conduct in the world.
author: Sigmund Freud

quote: Work and love - these are the basics  waking life is a dream controlled.
author: George Santayana

quote: Outside  among your fellows  among strangers  you must preserve appearances  a hundred things you cannot do  but inside  the terrible freedom!
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Sanity is very rare  every man almost  and every woman  has a dash of madness.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Mad  bad and dangerous to know.
author: Lady Caroline

quote: We are all born mad. Some remain so.
author: Samuel Beckett

quote: There is a pleasure sure  In being mad  which none but madmen know!
author: John Dryden

quote: He not only overflowed with learning  but stood in the slop.
author: Sydney Smith

quote: If we wish to know the force of human genius  we should read Shakespeare. If we wish to see the insignificance of human learning  we may study his commentators.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: The clever men at Oxford Know all there is to be knowed - But they none of them know as half as much As intelligent Mr. Toad.
author: Kenneth Grahame

quote: Research  as the college student will come to know it  is relatively thorough investigation  primarily in libraries  of a properly limited topic  and presentation of the results of this investigation in a carefully organized and documented paper of some length.
author: Cecil B. Williams

quote: A man should keep his little brain attic stocked with all the furniture that he is likely to use  and the rest he can put away in the lumber-room of his library  where he can get it if he wants it.
author: Arthur Conan Doyle

quote: What is research  but a blind date with knowledge?
author: Will Henry

quote: If I had read as much as other men  I should have known no more than they.
author: Thomas Hobbes

quote: Deep-versed in books And shallow in himself.
author: John Milton

quote: Learning is the knowledge of that which none but the learned know.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: I would live to study  not study to live.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: Almost all important questions are important precisely because they are not susceptible to quantitative answer.
author: Arthur Schlesinger

quote: The schools ain't what they used to be and never was.
author: Will Rogers

quote: I pay the School Master  but 'tis the school boys that educate my son.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Schoolmasters and parents exist to be grown out of.
author: John Wolfenden

quote: If school results were the key to power  girls would be running the world.
author: Sarah Boseley

quote: Example is the school of mankind  and they will learn at no other.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: Failure is a school in which the truth always grows strong.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: If law school is so hard to get through  how come there are so many lawyers?
author: Calvin Trillin

quote: All science is either Physics or stamp-collecting.
author: Lord Kelvin

quote: As far as the laws of Mathematics refer to reality  they are not certain  and as far as they are certain  they do not refer to reality.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: He had read Shakespeare and found him weak in chemistry.
author: H. G. Wells

quote: I am sorry to say there is too much point to the wise crack that life is extinct on other planets because their scientists were more advanced than ours.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: If all the arts aspire to the condition of music  all the sciences aspire to the condition of mathematics.
author: George Santayana

quote: If the human race wants to go to Hell in a basket  technology can help it get there by jet.
author: Charles M. Allen

quote: In science  all facts  no matter how trivial or banal  enjoy democratic equality.
author: Mary McCarthy

quote: Life exists in the universe only because the carbon atom possesses certain exceptional properties.
author: James Jeans

quote: Light is the ultimate messenger of the universe.
author: BBC World Service

quote: Most science is only high falutin' nature studies.
author: Stephen Strauss

quote: My advice is to look out for engineers - they begin with sewing machines and end up with the atomic bomb.
author: Marcel Pagnol

quote: Never try to walk across a river just because it has an average depth of four feet.
author: Martin Friedman

quote: Reason  observation  and experience - the Holy Trinity of Science.
author: Robert G. Ingersoll

quote: Science is built of facts the way a house is built of bricks  but an accumulation of facts is no more science than a pile of bricks is a house.
author: Henri Poincare

quote: Science without religion is lame  religion without science is blind.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Scientific discovery consists in the interpretation for our own convenience of a system of existence which has been made with no eye to our convenience at all.
author: Norbert Wiener

quote: The means by which we live have outdistanced the ends for which we live. Our scientific power has outrun our spiritual power. We have guided missiles and misguided men.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote: The scientific theory I like best is that the rings of Saturn are composed entirely of lost airline luggage.
author: Mike Russell

quote: The simplest schoolboy is now familiar with truths for which Archimedes would have sacrificed his life.
author: Ernest Renan

quote: Wetenschap is wat wetenschappers doen - Science is what scientists do.
author: Dennis Flanagan

quote: Technology - the knack of so arranging the world that we don't have to experience it.
author: Max Frisch

quote: The great tragedy of Science: the slaying of a beautiful hypothesis by an ugly fact.
author: Thomas Huxley

quote: Technology means the systematic application of scientific or other organized knowledge to practical tasks.
author: J. K. Galbraith

quote: Whenever science makes a discovery  the devil grabs it while the angels are debating the best way to use it.
author: Alan Valentine

quote: Science cannot stop while ethics catches up - and nobody should expect scientists to do all the thinking for the country.
author: Elvin Stackman

quote: Science must constantly be reminded that her purposes are not the only purposes and that the order of uniform causation which she has use for  and is therefore right in postulating  may be enveloped in a wider order  on which she has no claim at all.
author: William James

quote: Science is the attempt to make the chaotic diversity of our sense-experience correspond to a logically uniform system of thought.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Though many have tried  no one has ever yet explained away the decisive fact that science  which can do so much  cannot decide what it ought to do.
author: Joseph Wood Krutch

quote: It may be bizarre  but in my opinion  science offers a sure path to God and religion.
author: Paul Davies

quote: As both the Mercury and Apollo programs have shown  our science and technology are so powerful that  if an intense effort is made  we can do almost anything we want in say  ten years - provided we are not in conflict with the laws of nature.
author: Hannes Alfvin

quote: The new electronic interdependence recreates the world in the image of a global village.
author: Marshall McLuhan

quote: Research is the process of going up alleys to see if they are blind.
author: Marston Bates

quote: Research is to see what everybody has seen  and to think what nobody else has thought.
author: Albert Szent-Gyorgyi

quote: No scientific theory achieves public acceptance until it has been thoroughly discredited.
author: Douglas Yates

quote: The first rule of intelligent tinkering is to save all the parts.
author: Paul R. Ehrlich

quote: Computers can figure out all kinds of problems  except the things in the world that just don't add up.
author: James Magary

quote: The World would be a safer place  If someone had a plan  Before exploring Outer Space  To find the Inner Man.
author: E. Y. Harburg

quote: No amount of experimentation can ever prove me right  a single experiment can prove me wrong.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: I think and think for months and years. Ninety-nine times  the conclusion is false. The hundredth time I am right
author: Albert Einstein

quote: There is more than a mere suspicion that the scientist who comes to ask metaphysical questions and turns away from metaphysical answers may be afraid of those answers.
author: Gregory Zilboorg

quote: In science the credit goes to the man who convinces the world  not to the man to whom the idea first occurs.
author: William Osier

quote: The perfect computer has been developed. You just feed in your problems  and they never come out again.
author: Al Goodman

quote: Electric clocks reveal to you Precisely when your fuses blew.
author: Leonard Schiff

quote: The telephone is the most important single technological resource of later life.
author: Alex Comfort

quote: E = MC^2: Energy equals mass times the speed of light squared.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Space isn't remote at all. It's only an hour's drive away if your car could go straight upwards.
author: Fred Hoyle

quote: It is very seldom that the same man knows much of science  and about the things that were known before science came.
author: Lord Dunsany

quote: A science which hesitates to forget its founders is lost.
author: Alfred North Whitehead

quote: Pollution is nothing but resources we're not harvesting.
author: Buckminster Fuller

quote: Medieval Technology? The Middle Ages invented  among other things  the crank  the horse collar  eyeglasses  the flying buttress  the stirrup  the windmill  the wheelbarrow  printing  firearms  paper  the canal lock  the compass  the rudder  the mechanical clock  the spinning wheel  and the treadle.
author: Joseph and Frances Gies

quote: The best defence against the atom bomb is not to be there when it goes off.
author: The British Army Journal

quote: A few observations and much reasoning lead to error  many observations and a little reasoning to truth.
author: Alexis Carrel

quote: The most important of my discoveries have been suggested to me by my failures.
author: Sir Humphrey Davy

quote: Basic research is when I'm doing what I don't know what I'm doing.
author: Wernher von Braun

quote: Sit down before fact as a little child  be prepared to give up every preconceived notion  follow humbly wherever and to whatever abyss nature leads  or you shall learn nothing.
author: Thomas Huxley

quote: If I have seen farther it is by standing on the shoulders of giants.
author: Isaac Newton

quote: It is the theory which decided what can be observed.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Art is I  science is we.
author: Claude Bernard

quote: Every great advance in science has issued from a new audacity of imagination.
author: John Dewey

quote: Steam is no stronger now than it was a hundred years ago  but it is put to better use.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Science and art belong to the whole world  and before them vanish the barriers of nationality.
author: Goethe

quote: Science is simply common sense at its best - that is  rigidly accurate in observation  and merciless to fallacy in logic.
author: T. H. Huxley

quote: Science is nothing but developed perception  interpreted intent  common sense rounded out  and minutely articulated.
author: George Santayana

quote: Science is the systematic classification of experience.
author: George Henry Lewes

quote: Science is nothing but perception.
author: Plato

quote: Science is organized knowledge.
author: Herbert Spencer

quote: Give me but one hour of Scotland  Let me see it ere I die.
author: Wiluam E. Aytoun

quote: O Caledonia! stern and wild  Meet nurse for a poetic child! Land of brown heath and shaggy wood  Land of the mountain and the flood  Land of my sires! what mortal hand Can e'er untie the filial band  That knits me to thy rugged strand!
author: Walter Scott

quote: A glory gilds the sacred page  Majestic like the sun  It gives a light to every age  It gives  but borrows none.
author: William Cowper

quote: Thy word is a lamp unto my feet and a light unto my path.
author: Bible

quote: We search the world for truth  we cull The good  the pure  the beautiful  From all old flower fields of the soul  And  weary seekers of the best  We come back laden from our quest  To find that all the sages said Is in the Book our mothers read.
author: John Greenleaf Whittier

quote: Madam de Stael pronounced architecture to be frozen music  so is statuary crystalized spirituality.
author: Louisa May Alcott

quote: Then marble  soften'd into life  grew warm.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Praise the sea  on shore remain.
author: John Florio

quote: He that will learn to pray  let him go to sea.
author: George Edward Herbert

quote: I must go down to the seas again  to the lonely sea and the sky  And all I ask is a tall ship and a star to steer her by.
author: John Masefield

quote: The sea hath no king but God alone.
author: Christina Rossetti

quote: Break  break  break  On thy cold gray stones  O sea! And I would that my tongue could utter The thoughts that arise in me.
author: Lord Alfred Tennyson

quote: Autumn to winter  winter into spring. Spring  into summer  summer into fall  -  So rolls the changing year  and so we change  -Motion so swift  we know not that we move.
author: Dinah Mulock Craik

quote: Spring is a virgin  Summer a mother  Autumn a widow  and Winter a stepmother.
author: Polish proverb

quote: There is a skeleton in every house.
author: Anonymous

quote: A man can hide all things  excepting twain -  That he is drunk  and that he is in love.
author: Antiphanes

quote: The secret things belong unto the Lord our God.
author: Bible

quote: Nothing is secret which shall not be made manifest.
author: Bible

quote: If you would wish another to keep your secret  first keep it yourself.
author: Seneca

quote: What is told in the ear of a man is often heard 100 miles away.
author: Chinese saying

quote: Two things a man cannot hide: that he is drunk  and that he is in love.
author: Antiphanes

quote: Nothing is so burdensome as a secret.
author: French proverb

quote: It is a secret in the Oxford sense. You may tell it to only one person at a time.
author: Oliver Franks

quote: I know that's a secret  for it's whispered everywhere.
author: William Congreve

quote: All the knowledge I possess everyone else can acquire  but my heart is all my own.
author: Goethe

quote: Shy and unready men are great betrayers of secrets  for there are few wants more urgent for the moment than the want of something to say.
author: Henry Taylor

quote: In the mind and nature of a man a secret is an ugly thing  like a hidden physical defect.
author: Isak Dinesen

quote: Be secret and exult  Because of all things known That is most difficult.
author: William Butler Yeats

quote: If you wish to preserve your secret  wrap it up in frankness.
author: Alexander Smith

quote: Where secrecy reigns  carelessness and ignorance delight to hide - skill loves the light.
author: Daniel C. Gelman

quote: Whatsoever ye have spoken in darkness shall be heard in the light  and that which ye have spoken in the ear in closets shall be proclaimed upon the housetops.
author: Bible

quote: Even in your thought  do not curse the king  nor in your bedchamber curse the rich  for a bird of the air will carry your voice  or some winged creature tell the matter.
author: Bible

quote: Security is mostly superstition. It does not exist in nature. ... Avoiding danger is no safer in the long run than outright exposure. The fearful are caught as often as the bold.
author: Helen Keller

quote: Security is a false god  begin making sacrifices to it and you are lost.
author: Paul Bowles

quote: God Himself is not secure  having given man dominion over His works.
author: Helen Keller

quote: The man who looks for security  even in the mind  is like a man who would chop off his limbs in order to have artificial ones which will give him no pain or trouble.
author: Henry Miller

quote: Never think you've seen the last of anything.
author: Eudora Welty

quote: If you want total security  go to prison. There you're fed  clothed  given medical care and so on. The only thing lacking ... is freedom.
author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quote: Life is not orderly. No matter how we try to make life so  right in the middle of it we die  lose a leg  fall in love  drop a jar of applesauce.
author: Natalie Goldberg

quote: Truly nothing is to be expected but the unexpected.
author: Alice James

quote: Happiness  greatness  pride-nothing is secure  nothing keeps.
author: Euripides

quote: There is no security  no assurance that because we wrote something good two months ago  we will do it again. Actually  every time we begin  we wonder how we ever did it before.
author: Natalie Goldberg

quote: There is no security on this earth. Only opportunity.
author: General Douglas MacArthur

quote: There is no way to take the danger out of human relationships.
author: Barbara Grizzuti Harrison

quote: It is the risk element which ensures security. Risk brings out the ingenuity and resourcefulness which insure success.
author: Robert Rawls

quote: The way to be safe is never to be secure.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: We are never more in danger than when we think ourselves most secure  nor in reality more secure than when we seem to be most in danger.
author: William Cowper

quote: It is when we all play safe that we create a world of utmost insecurity.
author: Dag Hammarskjold

quote: To keep oneself safe does not mean to bury oneself.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: "Safety first" has been the motto of the human race for half a million years  but it has never been the motto of leaders.
author: Anonymous

quote: If money is your hope for independence you will never have it. The only real security that a man can have in this world is a reserve of knowledge  experience and ability.
author: Henry Ford

quote: Our greatest illusion is reliance upon the security and permanence of material possessions. We must search for some other coin.
author: John Cudahy

quote: The only peace  the only security  is in fulfillment.
author: Henry Miller

quote: Solvency is entirely a matter of temperament  not of income.
author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quote: Security depends not so much upon how much you have  as upon how much you can do without.
author: Joseph Wood Krutch

quote: Security can only be achieved through constant change  through discarding old ideas that have outlived their usefulness and adapting others to current facts.
author: William O. Douglas

quote: Truth is the only safe ground to stand upon.
author: Elizabeth Cady Stanton

quote: Only in growth  reform  and change  paradoxically enough  is true security to be found.
author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

quote: Security is not the absence of danger  but the presence of God  no matter what the danger.
author: Anonymous

quote: I'm in love with the potential of miracles. For me  the safest place is out on a limb.
author: Shirley MacLaine

quote: Man's security comes from within himself.
author: Manly Hall

quote: You are all you will ever have for certain.
author: June Havoc

quote: No one can builu her security upon the nobleness of another person.
author: Willa Cather

quote: Your real security is yourself. You know you can do it  and they can't ever take that away from you.
author: Mae West

quote: Only those means of security are good  are certain  are lasting  that depend on yourself and your own vigor.
author: Niccolo Machiavelli

quote: Uncertainty and expectation are the joys of life. Security is an insipid thing.
author: William Congreve

quote: Freedom works.
author: Jeane Kirkpatrick

quote: To be on the alert is to live  to be lulled into security is to die.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Prudence keeps life safe  but does not often make it happy.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Whatever course you have chosen for yourself  it will not be a chore but an adventure if you bring to it a sense of the glory of striving ... if your sights are set far above the merely secure and mediocre.
author: David Sarnoff

quote: Security is a kind of death.
author: Tennessee Williams

quote: Without danger we cannot get beyond danger.... Each one of us requires the spur of insecurity to force us to do our best.
author: Dr. Harold W. Dodds

quote: Nerves provide me with energy. ... It's when I don't have them  when I feel at ease  that I get worried.
author: Mike Nichols

quote: Protection and security are only valuable if they do not cramp life excessively.
author: Carl Jung

quote: Too many people are thinking of security instead of opportunity  they seem more afraid of life than of death.
author: James F. Byrnes

quote: The one permanent emotion of the inferior man is fear-fear of the unknown  the complex  the inexplicable. What he wants beyond everything else is safety.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: We spend our time searching for security and hate it when we get it.
author: John Steinbeck

quote: Be like the bird that  passing on her flight awhile on boughs too slight  feels them give way beneath her  and yet sings  knowing that she hath wings.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: We hear of a silent generation  more concerned with security than integrity  with conforming than performing  with imitating than creating.
author: Thomas J. Watson

quote: A man cannot be comfortable without his own approval.
author: Mark Twain

quote: An old man concludeth from his knowing mankind that they know him too  and that maketh him very wary.
author: Lord Halifax

quote: A sick man that gets talking about himself  a woman that gets talking about her baby  and an author that begins reading out of his own book  never know when to stop.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: Each man must look to himself to teach him the meaning of life. It is not something discovered  it is something moulded.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quote: Egotism: the art of seeing in yourself what others cannot see.
author: George Higgins

quote: Every one is bound to bear patiently the results of his own example.
author: Phaedrus

quote: He who is in love with himself has at least this advantage he won't encounter many rivals.
author: G. C. Lichtenberg

quote: If you can't bite  don't show your teeth.
author: Old saying

quote: Know him  know me.
author: Dizzy Gillespie

quote: Man who man would be  must rule the empire of himself.
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote: No man does anything from a single motive.
author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

quote: Nobody can honestly think of himself as a strong character because  however successful he may be in overcoming them  he is necessarily aware of the doubts and temptations that accompany every important choice.
author: W. H. Auden

quote: We carry with us the wonders we seek without us.
author: Sir Thomas Browne

quote: What the collective age wants  allows and approves  is the perpetual holiday from the self.
author: Thomas Mann

quote: When a man is wrapped up in himself he makes a pretty small package.
author: John Ruskin

quote: Who's not sat tense before his own heart's curtain?
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

quote: If a man really knew himself he would utterly despise the ignorant notions others might form on a subject in which he had such matchless opportunities for observation.
author: George Santayana

quote: With every physical pain  my moral fibre unravels a little.
author: Mason Cooley

quote: I have never seen a greater monster or miracle in the world than myself.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: We are all serving a life sentence in the dungeon of self.
author: Cyril Connolly

quote: One may understand the cosmos  but never the ego  the self is more distant than any star.
author: G. K. Chesterton

quote: We judge ourselves by our motives and others by their actions.
author: Dwight Morrow

quote: There is nothing noble about being superior to some other man. The true nobility is in being superior to your previous self.
author: Hindu proverb

quote: Self-confidence is the first requisite to great undertakings.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Never to talk of oneself is a form of hypocrisy.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Goethe said there would be little left of him if you were to discard what he owed to others.
author: Charlotte Cushman

quote: Be yourself. Who else is better qualified?
author: Frank J. Giblin

quote: I don't think anyone is free - one creates one's own prison.
author: Graham Sutherland

quote: I am I plus my circumstances.
author: Josi Ortega y Gasset

quote: I think somehow we learn who we really are and then live with that decision.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: There is nothing will kill a man so soon as having nobody to find fault with but himself.
author: George Eliot

quote: I am as bad as the worst  but  thank God  I am as good as the best.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: A man can stand a lot as long as he can stand himself. He can live without hope  without friends  without books  even without music  as long as he can listen to his own thoughts.
author: Axel Munthe

quote: If you really do put a small value upon yourself  rest assured that the world will not raise your price.
author: Anonymous

quote: If I am not for myself  who will be?
author: Pirke Avot

quote: The greatest success is successful self-acceptance.
author: Ben Sweet

quote: Compassion for myself is the most powerful healer of them all.
author: Theodore Isaac Rubin

quote: Self-respect is the root of discipline: the sense of dignity grows with the ability to say no to oneself.
author: Abraham J. Heschel

quote: If you know nothing  be pleased to know nothing.
author: John Newlove

quote: I am more afraid of my own heart than of the Pope and all his cardinals. I have within me the great Pope  Self.
author: Martin Luther

quote: The happy man is he who knows his limitations  yet bows to no false gods.
author: Robert Service

quote: From without  no wonderful effect is wrought within ourselves  unless some interior  responding wonder meets it.
author: Herman Melville

quote: Nobody knows what's in him until he tries to pull it out. If there's nothing  or very little  the shock can kill a man.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: Blessed are they who heal us of self-despisings. Of all services which can be done to man  I know of none more precious.
author: William Hale White

quote: When three people call you an ass  put on a bridle.
author: Spanish proverb

quote: A complete life may be one ending in so full an identification with the not-self that there is no self left to die.
author: Bernard Berenson

quote: A show of envy is an insult to oneself.
author: Yevgeny Yevtushenko

quote: Maturity consists of no longer being taken in by oneself.
author: Kajetan von Schlaggenberg

quote: Our own interests are still an exquisite means for dazzling our eyes agreeably.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: To penetrate one's being  one must go armed to the teeth.
author: Paul Valery

quote: Men at some time are masters of their fates: The fault  dear Brutus  is not in our stars  But in ourselves  that we are underlings.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Self-reverence  self-knowledge  self-control - these three alone lead to sovereign power.
author: Alfred, Lord Tennyson

quote: There are limits to self-indulgence  none to self-restraint.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Integrity simply means a willingness not to violate one's identity.
author: Erich Fromm

quote: The important thing is not what they think of me  it is what I think of them.
author: Victoria, Queen of England

quote: I think Dostoevsky was right  that every human being must have a point at which he stands against the culture  where he says  this is me and the damned world can go to hell.
author: Rollo May

quote: O wad some Pow'r the giftie gie us To see oursels as others see us. It wad frae money a blunder free us  And foolish notion.
author: Robert Burns

quote: Self-respecting people do not care to peep at their reflections in unexpected mirrors  or to see themselves as others see them.
author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quote: Self-command is the main elegance.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: No one can make you feel inferior without your consent.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: I am better than my reputation.
author: Friedrich von Schiller

quote: Do I contradict myself? Very well  then I contradict myself  I am large  I contain multitudes.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: Be thine own palace  or the world's thy jail.
author: John Donne

quote: Do not make yourself so big. You are not so small.
author: Jewish proverb

quote: Individualism is rather like innocence  there must be something unconscious about it.
author: Louis Kronenberger

quote: I am as my Creator made me  and since He is satisfied  so am I.
author: Minnie Smith

quote: I live in the crowds of jollity  not so much to enjoy company as to shun myself.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: I refuse to try to explain everything  because if you know too much about yourself  you become impotent. Better not to know what it is that makes you tick.
author: Paul Wunderlich

quote: Every man shall bear his own burden.
author: Bible

quote: I seem to have an awful lot of people inside me.
author: Edith Evans

quote: There is no crime of which I do not deem myself capable.
author: Goethe

quote: I shall stay the way I am Because I do not give a damn.
author: Dorothy Parker

quote: I have been a selfish being all my life  in practice  though not in principle.
author: Jane Austen

quote: God knows  I'm no the thing I should be  Nor am I even the thing I could be.
author: Robert Burns

quote: In the main it is not by introspection but by reflecting on our living in common with others that we come to know ourselves. What is revealed? It is an original creation. Freely the subject makes himself what he is  never in this life is the making finished  always it is in process  always it is a precarious achievement that can slip and fall and shatter.
author: Bernard Lonergan

quote: I'm a vague  conjunctured personality  more made up of opinions and academic prepossessions than of human traits and red corpuscles.
author: Woodrow Wilson

quote: to be nobody but yourself- in a world which is doing its best  night and day  to make you everybody else - means to fight the hardest battle which any human being can fight  and never stop fighting.
author: e. e. cummings

quote: Learn what you are  and be such.
author: Pindar

quote: My great mistake  the fault for which I can't forgive myself  is that one day I ceased my obstinate pursuit of my own individuality.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: A man must learn to forgive himself.
author: Arthur Davison Ficke

quote: I have come back again to where I belong  not an enchanted place  but the walls are strong.
author: Dorothy H. Rath

quote: There's only one corner of the universe you can be certain of improving and that's your own self.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: It is not only the most difficult thing to know oneself  but the most inconvenient one  too.
author: Josh Billings

quote: To know oneself  one should assert oneself.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Every new adjustment is a crisis in self-esteem.
author: Eric Hoffer

quote: There is no greater delight than to be conscious of sincerity on self-examination.
author: Mencius

quote: Whatever you may be sure of  be sure of this - that you are dreadfully like other people.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: All life is the struggle  the effort to be itself. The difficulties which I meet with in order to realize my existence are precisely what awaken and mobilize my activities  my capacities.
author: Josi Ortega y Gasset

quote: My closest relation is myself.
author: Terence

quote: I care not so much what I am to others as what I am to myself. I will be rich by myself  and not by borrowing.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: You can succeed if nobody else believes it  but you will never succeed if you don't believe in yourself.
author: William J. H. Boetcker

quote: Cautious  careful people  always casting about to preserve their reputation and social standing  never can bring about a reform.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: Everybody wants to do something to help  but nobody wants to be first.
author: Pearl Bailey

quote: It is not easy to be a pioneer-but oh  it is fascinating! I would not trade one moment  even the worst moment  for all the riches in the world.
author: Elizabeth Blackwell

quote: Do not attempt to do a thing unless you are sure of yourself  but do not relinquish it simply because someone else is not sure of you.
author: Stewart E. White

quote: No one can make you feel inferior without your consent.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: Every man stamps his value on himself ... man is made great or small by his own will.
author: J. C. F. von Schiller

quote: The decision to speak out is the vocation and lifelong peril by which the intellectual must live.
author: Kay Boyle

quote: Let us not forget that among [women's] rights is the right to speak freely.
author: Hillary Rodham Clinton

quote: Let a man's talents or virtues be what they may  he will only feel satisfaction as he is satisfied in himself.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: I've always tried to go a step past wherever people expected me to end up.
author: Beverly Sills

quote: The widening of woman's sphere is to improve her lot. Let us do it  and if the world scoff  let it scoff-if it sneer  let it sneer.
author: Lucy Stone

quote: It's just like magic. When you live by yourself  all your annoying habits are gone!
author: Merrill Markoe

quote: When people say: she's got everything  I've only one answer: I haven't had tomorrow.
author: Elizabeth Taylor

quote: Cuteness in children is totally an adult perspective. The children themselves are unaware that the quality exists  let alone its desirability  until the reactions of grown-ups inform them.
author: Leontine Young

quote: It is not the eyes of others that I am wary of  but my own.
author: Noel Coward

quote: Do not let your peace depend on the hearts of men  whatever they say about you  good or bad  you are not because of it another man  for as you are  you are.
author: Thomas a Kempis

quote: In my business  you measure your respect by the enemies you make.
author: Theo E. Colborn

quote: Not knowing when the dawn will come  I open every door.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: We would worry less about what others think of us if we realized how seldom they do.
author: Ethel Barrett

quote: A man cannot be comfortable without his own approval.
author: Mark Twain

quote: I have come to believe over and over again that what is most important to me must be spoken  made verbal and shared  even at the risk of having it bruised or misunderstood.
author: Audre Lorde

quote: The worst loneliness is not to be comfortable with yourself.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Perhaps the most important thing we can undertake toward the reduction of fear is to make it easier for people to accept themselves  to like themselves.
author: Bonaro Overstreet

quote: I have had more trouble with myself than with any other man.
author: Dwight L. Moody

quote: What you think about yourself is much more important than what others think of you.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: What a man thinks of himself  that is what determines  or rather indicates  his fate.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: As soon as you trust yourself  you will know how to live.
author: Johann von Goethe

quote: He who seeks for applause only from without has all his happiness in another's keeping.
author: Oliver Goldsmith

quote: From self alone expect applause.
author: Marion L. Burton

quote: Confronted by an absolutely infuriating review  it is sometimes helpful for the victim to do a little personal research on the critic. Is there any truth to the rumor that he had no formal education beyond the age of eleven? In any event  is he able to construct a simple English sentence? Do his participles dangle? When moved to lyricism  does he write "I had a fun time"? Was he ever arrested for burglary? I don't know that you will prove anything this way  but it is perfectly harmless and quite soothing.
author: Jean Kerr

quote: You can enjoy encouragement coming from outside  but you cannot need for it to come from outside.
author: Vladimir Zworykin

quote: Next to God we are indebted to women  first for life itself  and then for making it worth living.
author: Mary McLeod Bethune

quote: I am not belittling the brave pioneer men but the sunbonnet as well as the sombrero has helped to settle this glorious land of ours.
author: Edna Ferber

quote: The older women were Sunbeams and I guess we were Cherubs or Lambs  but our mothers were Nightingales.
author: Janet Flanner

quote: Do not look for approval except for the consciousness of doing your best.
author: Bernard M. Baruch

quote: I exist as I am  that is enough  If no other in the world be aware  I sit content  And if each and all be aware  I sit content.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: Nobody can be exactly like me. Sometimes even I have trouble doing it.
author: Tallulah Bankhead

quote: No matter how lonely you get or how many birth announcements you receive  the trick is not to get frightened. There's nothing wrong with being alone.
author: Wendy Wasserstein

quote: I was always willing to take a great deal of the burden of getting along in life on my own shoulders  but I wasn't willing to give myself a pat on the back. I was always looking to somebody else to give me that. ... That was all wrong.
author: Raquel Welch

quote: She lacks confidence  she craves admiration insatiably. She lives on the reflections of herself in the eyes of others. She does not dare to be herself.
author: Anais Nin

quote: Blessed is he who expects no gratitude  for he shall not be disappointed.
author: William Bennett

quote: When you know you are doing your very best within the circumstances of your existence  applaud yourself!
author: Rusty Berkus

quote: To accept ourselves as we are means to value our imperfections as much as our perfections.
author: Sandra Bierig

quote: I've learned to take time for myself and to treat myself with a great deal of love and respect 'cause I like me.... I think I'm kind of cool.
author: Whoopi Goldberg

quote: Spirituality is ... the awareness that survival is the savage fight between you and yourself.
author: Anonymous

quote: I am the only real truth I know.
author: Jean Rhys

quote: Not in the shouts and plaudits of the throng  but in ourselves  are triumph and defeat.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: If there are two hundred people in a room and one of them doesn't like me  I've got to get out.
author: Marlon Brando

quote: No man is defeated without until he has first been defeated within.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: To make the choice for independent survival  the great man's wife has to become convinced of her own intrinsic worth.
author: Joanna T. Steichen

quote: I care not what others think of what I do  but I care very much about what I think of what I do. That is character!
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: I am somebody. I am me. I like being me. And I need nobody to make me somebody.
author: Louis L'Amour

quote: Life  I fancy  would very often be insupportable  but for the luxury of self-compassion.
author: George R. Gissing

quote: The work praises the man.
author: Irish proverb

quote: Of all afflictions  the worst is self-contempt.
author: Berthold Auerbach

quote: If you must love your neighbor as yourself  it is at least as fair to love yourself as your neighbor.
author: Nicolas de Chamfort

quote: Believing in our hearts that who we are is enough is the key to a more satisfying and balanced life.
author: Ellen Sue Stern

quote: I... know what I do  and am unmoved by men's blame  or their praise either.
author: Robert Browning

quote: My unreality is chiefly this: I have never felt much like a human being. It's a splendid feeling.
author: Margaret Anderson

quote: The mind can store an estimated ioo trillion bits of information-compared with which a computer's mere billions are virtually amnesiac.
author: Sharon Begley

quote: The mind's cross-indexing puts the best librarian to shame.
author: Sharon Begley

quote: If school results were the key to power  girls would be running the world.
author: Sarah Boseley

quote: There is no balking genius. Only death can silence it or hinder.
author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox

quote: An artist can show things that other people are terrified of expressing.
author: Louise Bourgeois

quote: True genius doesn't fulfill expectations  it shatters them.
author: Arlene Croce

quote: Next to genius is the power of feeling where true genius lies.
author: Sarah Josepha Hale

quote: If I had influence with the good fairy who is supposed to preside over the christening of all children  I should ask that her gift to each child in the world be a sense of wonder so indestructible that it would last throughout life as an unfailing antidote against the boredom and disenchant-ments of later years  the sterile preoccupation with things that are artificial  the alienation from the sources of our strength.
author: Rachel Carson

quote: You are unique  and if that is not fulfilled then something has been lost.
author: Martha Graham

quote: The thing that makes you exceptional  if you are at all  is inevitably that which must also make you lonely.
author: Lorraine Hansbury

quote: Everybody is talented  original  and has something important to say.
author: Brenda Ueland

quote: Cherish forever what makes you unique  'cuz you're really a yawn if it goes!
author: Bette Midler

quote: I didn't belong as a kid  and that always bothered me. If only I'd known that one day my differentness would be an asset  then my early life would have been much easier.
author: Bette Midler

quote: Genius is expansive  irresistible  and irresistibly expansive. If it is in you  no cords can confine it.
author: Gail Hamilton

quote: Since you are like no other being ever created since the beginning of time  you are incomparable.
author: Brenda Ueland

quote: Genius is the talent for seeing things straight. It is seeing things in a straight line without any bend or break or aberration of sight  seeing them as they are  without any warping of vision. Flawless mental sight! That is genius.
author: Maude Adams

quote: Children see things very well sometimes-and idealists even better.
author: Lorraine Hansbury

quote: Freedom is always and exclusively freedom for the one who thinks differently.
author: Rosa Luxemburg

quote: The person who can combine frames of reference and draw connections between ostensibly unrelated points of view is likely to be the one who makes the creative breakthrough.
author: Denise Shekerjian

quote: Art is the signature of civilizations.
author: Beverly Sills

quote: Every single one of us can do things that no one else can do-can love things that no one else can love. We are like violins. We can be used for doorstops  or we can make music.
author: Barbara Sher

quote: If God had wanted me otherwise  He would have created me otherwise.
author: Johann von Goethe

quote: Love your self's self where it lives.
author: Anne Sexton

quote: I am what I am  so take me as I am!
author: Johann von Goethe

quote: Be content with what you are  and wish not change  nor dread your last day  nor long for it.
author: Martial

quote: It is the chiefest point of happiness that a man is willing to be what he is.
author: Erasmus

quote: Who I am is the best I can be.
author: Leontyne Price

quote: Oh  I'm so inadequate. And I love myself!
author: Meg Ryan

quote: Learn what you are and be such.
author: Pindar

quote: What thou art  that thou art.
author: Thomas a Kempis

quote: I is who I is.
author: Tom Peterson

quote: People remain what they are  even when their faces fall to pieces.
author: Bertolt Brecht

quote: You have to deal with the fact that your life is your life.
author: Alex Haley

quote: The search for a new personality is futile  what is fruitful is the interest the old personality can take in new activities.
author: Cesare Pavese

quote: I seldom think about my limitations  and they never make me sad. Perhaps there is just a touch of yearning at times  but it is vague  like a breeze among flowers.
author: Helen Keller

quote: In order to be irreplaceable one must always be different.
author: Coco Chanel

quote: The courage to be is the courage to accept oneself  in spite of being unacceptable.
author: Paul Tillich

quote: Contentment  and indeed usefulness  comes as the infallible result of great acceptances  great humilities-of not trying to conform to some dramatized version of ourselves.
author: David Grayson

quote: A man should not strive to eliminate his complexes but to get into accord with them  for they are legitimately what directs his conduct in the world.
author: Sigmund Freud

quote: Resolve to be thyself ... he who finds himself loses his misery!
author: Matthew Arnold

quote: There's a period of life when we swallow a knowledge of ourselves and it becomes either good or sour inside.
author: Pearl Bailey

quote: There is always a certain peace in being what one is  in being that completely.
author: Ugo Betti

quote: I'm not OK  you're not OK-and that's OK.
author: William Sloane Coffin

quote: We will discover the nature of our particular genius when we stop trying to conform to our own or to other people's models  learn to be ourselves  and allow our natural channel to open.
author: Shakti Gawain

quote: All the discontented people I know are trying to be something they are not  to do something they cannot do.
author: David Grayson

quote: Be yourself. The world worships the original.
author: Ingrid Bergman

quote: Best be yourself  imperial  plain  and true!
author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

quote: She soothed and solaced and celebrated  destroying her gift by maiming it to suit her hearers.
author: Martha Bacon

quote: It is better to be hated for what you are than loved for what you are not.
author: Andre Gide

quote: Borrowed thoughts  like borrowed money  only show the poverty of the borrower.
author: Lady Marguerite Blessington

quote: Do not wish to be anything but what you are.
author: Saint Francis de Sales

quote: Every man must at last accept himself for his portion  and learn to do his work with the tools and talents with which he has been endowed.
author: Charles A. Hawley

quote: No person has the right to rain on your dreams.
author: Marian Wright Edelman

quote: Of all our infirmities  the most savage is to despise our being.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: Our entire life ... consists ultimately in accepting ourselves as we are.
author: Jean Anouilh

quote: The secret of my success is that at an early age I discovered I was not God.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: To find the good life you must become yourself.
author: Dr. Bill Jackson

quote: Man has to live with the body and soul which have fallen to him by chance.
author: Jose Ortega y Gasset

quote: Be content with what you are  and wish not change  nor dread your last day  nor long for it.
author: Martial

quote: Change occurs when one becomes what she is  not when she tries to become what she is not.
author: Ruth P. Freedman

quote: A man can stand a lot as long as he can stand himself.
author: Axel Munthe

quote: I've finally stopped running away from myself. Who else is there better to be?
author: Goldie Hawn

quote: Human beings aren't orchids  we must draw something from the soil we grow in.
author: Sara Jeannette Duncan

quote: We expect more of ourselves than we have any right to.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: I think knowing what you cannot do is more important than knowing what you can.
author: Lucille Ball

quote: Try as hard as we may for perfection  the net result of our labors is an amazing variety of imperfectness. We are surprised at our own versatility in being able to fail in so many different ways.
author: Samuel McChord Crothers

quote: Most of us have trouble juggling. The woman who says she doesn't is someone whom I admire but have never met.
author: Barbara Walters

quote: A sobering thought: what if  right at this very moment  I am living up to my full potential?
author: Jane Wagner

quote: Do not lose courage in considering your own imperfections.
author: Saint Francis de Sales

quote: We set up harsh and unkind rules against ourselves. No one is born without faults. That man is best who has fewest.
author: Horace

quote: One must not hope to be more than one can be.
author: Nicolas de Chamfort

quote: I long to see everything  to know everything  to learn everything!
author: Marie Bashkirtseff

quote: I can't write a book commensurate with Shakespeare  but I can write a book by me.
author: Sir Walter Raleigh

quote: I have done what I could do in life  and if I could not do better  I did not deserve it. In vain I have tried to step beyond what bound me.
author: Maurice Maeterlinck

quote: Don't try to teach a whole course in one lesson.
author: Kathryn Murray

quote: The man with insight enough to admit his limitations comes nearest to perfection.
author: Johann von Goethe

quote: Growth begins when we start to accept our own weakness.
author: Jean Vanier

quote: To dream of the person you would like to be is to waste the person you are.
author: Anonymous

quote: Shall a man go and hang himself because he belongs to the race of pygmies  and not be the biggest pygmy that he can?
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Of all the young men in America only a few hundred can get into major league baseball  and of these only a handful in a decade can get into the Hall of Fame. So it goes in all human activity. ... Some become multimillionaires and chairmen of the board  and some of us must be content to play baseball at company picnics or manage a credit union without pay.
author: William Feather

quote: At thirty a man should know himself like the palm of his hand  know the exact number of his defects and qualities. ... And above all  accept these things.
author: Albert Camus

quote: You can't make the Duchess of Windsor into Rebecca of Sunnybrook Farm. The facts of life are very stubborn things.
author: Cleveland Amory

quote: Learn to ... be what you are  and learn to resign with a good grace all that you are not.
author: Henri Frederic Amiel

quote: We cannot all be masters.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: No man can climb out beyond the limitations of his own character.
author: John Morley

quote: Sometimes it is more important to discover what one cannot do  than what one can do.
author: Lin Yutang

quote: To do all that one is able to do is to be a man  to do all that one would like to do is to be a god.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: No one is expected to achieve the impossible.
author: French proverb

quote: A hero is a man who does what he can.
author: Romain Rolland

quote: It is only fools who keep straining at high C all their lives.
author: Charles Dudley Warner

quote: May God ... let me strive for attainable things.
author: Pindar

quote: Despair is the price one pays for setting himself an impossible aim.
author: Graham Greene

quote: We would have to settle for the elegant goal of becoming ourselves.
author: William Styron

quote: A great obstacle to happiness is to expect too much happiness.
author: Bernard de Fontenelle

quote: I cannot do everything  but still I can do something  and because I cannot do everything  I will not refuse to do something I can do.
author: Edward Everett Hale

quote: I hope to work  support my children and die quietly without pain.
author: Sean Connery

quote: As we advance in life  we learn the limits of our abilities.
author: J. A. Froude

quote: Striving for excellence motivates you  striving for perfection is demoralizing.
author: Dr. Harriet Braiker

quote: There is a proper balance between not asking enough of oneself and asking or expecting too much.
author: May Sarton

quote: It is enough that I am of value to somebody today.
author: Hugh Prather

quote: A tomb now suffices him for whom the whole world was not sufficient.
author: Alexander the Great

quote: To wish to act like angels while we are still in this world is nothing but folly.
author: Teresa of Avila

quote: It isn't important to come out on top  what matters is to be the one who comes out alive.
author: Bertolt Brecht

quote: I long to accomplish a great and noble task  but it my chief duty to accomplish small tasks as if they were great and noble.
author: Helen Keller

quote: The one important thing I have learned over the years is the difference between taking one's work seriously and taking one's self seriously. The first is imperative and the second is disastrous.
author: Margaret Fontey

quote: Friendship with oneself is all-important  because without it one cannot be friends with anyone else.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: How I relate to my inner self influences my relationships with all others. My satisfaction with myself and my satisfaction with other people are directly proportional.
author: Sue Atchley Ebaugh

quote: I was always looking outside myself for strength and confidence  but it comes from within. It is there all the time.
