author: Anna Freud

quote: If you want to be respected by others  the great thing is to respect yourself.
author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky

quote: If one is cruel to himself  how can we expect him to be compassionate with others?
author: Hasdai Ibn Shaprut

quote: Let a man's talents or virtues be what they may  he will only feel satisfaction in his society as he is satisfied in himself.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: To succeed is nothing-it's an accident. But to feel no doubts about oneself is something very different: it is character.
author: Marie Leneru

quote: No matter what age you are  or what your circumstances might be  you are special  and you still have something unique to offer. Your life  because of who you are  has meaning.
author: Barbara De Angelis

quote: The worst walls are never the ones you find in your way. The worst walls are the ones you put there- you build yourself. Those are the high ones  the thick ones  the ones with no doors in.
author: Ursula K. LeGuin

quote: Interest in the lives of others  the high evaluation of these lives  what are they but the overflow of the interest a man finds in himself  the value he attributes to his own being?
author: Sherwood Anderson

quote: I want to be remembered as the person who helped us restore faith in ourselves.
author: Wilma Pearl Mankiller

quote: Those people who are uncomfortable in themselves are disagreeable to others.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: Self-love is not opposed to the love of other people. You cannot really love yourself and do yourself a favor without doing other people a favor  and vice versa.
author: Dr. Karl Menninger

quote: Healthy personalities accept themselves not in any self-idolizing way  but in the sense that they see themselves as persons who are worth giving to another and worthy to receive from another.
author: William Klassen

quote: We should try to bring to any power what we have as women. We will destroy it all if we try to imitate that absolutely unfeeling  driving ambition that we have seen coming at us across the desk.
author: Colleen Dewhurst

quote: A man needs self-acceptance or he can't live with himself  he needs self-criticism or others can't live with him.
author: James A. Pike

quote: Nobody holds a good opinion of a man who has a low opinion of himself.
author: Anthony Trollope

quote: To love others  we must first learn to love ourselves.
author: Anonymous

quote: There is overwhelming evidence that the higher the level of self-esteem  the more likely one will treat others with respect  kindness  and generosity. People who do not experience self-love have little or no capacity to love others.
author: Nathaniel Branden

quote: You grow up the day you have your first real laugh at yourself.
author: Ethel Barrymore

quote: Imagination was given to us to compensate for what we are not  a sense of humor was provided to console us for what we are.
author: Mack McGinnis

quote: It is the duty of youth to bring its fresh powers to bear on social progress. Each generation of young people should be to the world like a vast reserve force to a tired army. They should lift the world forward. That is what they are for.
author: Charlotte P. Gilman

quote: I looked always outside of myself to see what I could make the world give me instead of looking within myself to see what was there.
author: Belle Livingstone

quote: A true man never frets about his place in the world  but just slides into it by the gravitation of his nature  and swings there as easily as a star.
author: Edwin H. Chapin

quote: My recipe for life is not being afraid of myself  afraid of what I think or of my opinions.
author: Eartha Kitt

quote: Accept the place the divine providence has found for you.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: I needed to find my way to write. I need about six hours of uninterrupted time in order to produce about two hours of writing  and when I accepted that and found the way to do it  then I was able to write.
author: Robert B. Parker

quote: When one is pretending the entire body revolts.
author: Anais Nin

quote: When you affirm your own Tightness in the universe  then you co-operate with others easily and automatically as part of your own nature. You  being yourself  help others be themselves.
author: Jane Roberts

quote: So prodigal was I of youth  Forgetting I was young  I worshipped dead men for their strength  Forgetting I was strong.
author: Vita Sackville-West

quote: Life is a very sad piece of buffoonery  because we have ... the need to fool ourselves continuously by the spontaneous creation of a reality ... which  from time to time  reveals itself to be vain and illusory.
author: Luigi Pirandello

quote: The deepest principle in human nature is the craving to be appreciated.
author: William James

quote: It's OK if you mess up. You should give yourself a break.
author: Billy Joel

quote: Who we are never changes. Who we think we are does.
author: Mary S. Almanac

quote: It is not easy to be sure that being yourself is worth the trouble  but [we do know] it is our sacred duty.
author: Florida Scott-Maxwell

quote: Each of us has a day ... when he has to accept  finally  the fact that he is a man.
author: Jean Anouilh

quote: Nature never repeats herself  and the possibilities of one human soul will never be found in another.
author: Elizabeth Cady Stanton

quote: Style is something peculiar to one person  it expresses one personality and one only  it cannot be shared.
author: Freya Stark

quote: If you put a woman in a man's position  she will be more efficient  but no more kind.
author: Fay Weldon

quote: Accept your humanness as well as your divinity  totally and without reserve.
author: Emmanuel

quote: The things we hate about ourselves aren't more real than things we like about ourselves.
author: Ellen Goodman

quote: Why can a man not act himself  be himself  and think for himself? It seems to me that naturalness alone is power  that a borrowed word is weaker than our own weakness  however small we may be.
author: Maria Mitchell

quote: Until you make peace with who you are  you'll never be content with what you have.
author: Doris Mortman

quote: If you make friends with yourself you will never be alone.
author: Maxwell Maltz

quote: It is a sign of strength  not of weakness  to admit that you don't know all the answers.
author: John P. Loughrane

quote: The fundamental problem most patients have is an inability to love themselves  having been unloved by others during some crucial part of their lives.
author: Bernie S. Siegel

quote: Who you are is a necessary step to being who you will be.
author: Emmanuel

quote: Ultimately  love is self approval.
author: Sondra Ray

quote: Unless I accept my faults  I will most certainly doubt my virtues.
author: Hugh Prather

quote: Too many people overvalue what they are not and undervalue what they are.
author: Malcolm Forbes

quote: If I am not for myself  who is for me? And if I am only for myself  what am I? And if not now  when?
author: Hillel

quote: Accept your defeats With your head up and your eyes open With the grace of woman  not the grief of a child ...
author: Kara DiGiovanna

quote: He who despises himself esteems himself as a self-despiser.
author: Susan Sontag

quote: Your problem is you're ... too busy holding onto your unworthiness.
author: Ram Dass

quote: Conceit spoils the finest genius. There is not much danger that real talent or goodness will be overlooked long  even if it is  the consciousness of possessing and using it well should satisfy one.
author: Louisa May Alcott

quote: People in big empty places are likely to behave very much as the gods did on Olympus.
author: Edna Ferber

quote: What makes humility so desirable is the marvelous thing it does to us  it creates in us a capacity for the closest possible intimacy with God.
author: Monica Baldwin

quote: Calm self-confidence is as far from conceit as the desire to earn a decent living is remote from greed.
author: Channing Pollock

quote: Big egos are big shields for lots of empty space.
author: Diana Black

quote: Self-love  my liege  is not so vile a sin as self-neglecting.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: The nice thing about egotists is that they don't talk about other people.
author: Lucille S. Harper

quote: There is nothing so skillful in its own defense as imperious pride.
author: Helen Hunt Jackson

quote: Wounded vanity knows when it is mortally hurt  and limps off the field  piteous  all disguises thrown away. But pride carries its banner to the last  and fast as it is driven from one field unfurls it in another.
author: Helen Hunt Jackson

quote: In our society those who are in reality superior in intelligence can be accepted by their fellows only if they pretend they are not.
author: Marya Mannes

quote: It is as proper to have pride in oneself as it is ridiculous to show it to others.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quote: If a man doesn't delight in himself and the force in him and feel that he and it are wonders  how is all life to become important to him?
author: Sherwood Anderson

quote: Your father used to say  "Never give away your work. People don't value what they don't have to pay for."
author: Nancy Hale

quote: Pride ... is the direct appreciation of oneself.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: Proud people breed sad sorrows for themselves.
author: Emily Bronte

quote: Beware of over-great pleasure in being popular or even beloved.
author: Margaret Fuller

quote: Soften my hard self-opinionatedness  which time has hardened so exceedingly!
author: Gertrude the Great

quote: Self-esteem isn't everything  it's just that there's nothing without it.
author: Gloria Steinem

quote: As soon as you trust yourself  you will know how to live.
author: Johann von Goethe

quote: It is far more impressive when others discover your good qualities without your help.
author: Judith Martin

quote: Humility is like underwear  essential but indecent if it shows.
author: Helen Nielsen

quote: The more important the title  the more self-important the person  the greater the amount of time spent on the Eastern shuttle  the more suspicious the man and the less vitality in the organization.
author: Jane O'Reilly

quote: I'm glad I never feel important  it does complicate life.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: More people are ruined by victory  I imagine  than by defeat.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: Vanity is the quicksand of reason.
author: George Sand

quote: I was somewhat drunk with what I had done. And I am always one to prefer being sober.
author: Gertrude Stein

quote: Our vanity is the constant enemy of our dignity.
author: Anne-Sophie Swetchine

quote: To have that sense of one's intrinsic worth which constitutes self-respect is potentially to have everything.
author: Joan Didion

quote: It is best to act with confidence  no matter how little right you have to it.
author: Lillian Hellman

quote: I've always seen myself as a winner  even as a kid. If I hadn't  I just might have gone down the drain a couple of times. I've got something inside of me  peasantlike and stubborn  and I'm in it 'til the end of the race.
author: Truman Capote

quote: Success doesn't necessarily make you a happy person ... but without the confidence and security that comes from being totally happy  I believe you cannot achieve your true potential and ultimate success.
author: Jinger Heath

quote: Self-respect will keep a man from being abject when he is in the power of enemies  and will enable him to feel that he may be in the right when the world is against him.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Tis the ignorant who boast.
author: Carmen Sylva

quote: Being powerful is like being a lady. If you have to tell people you are  you aren't.
author: Margaret Thatcher

quote: There's one blessing only  the source and cornerstone of beatitude: confidence in self.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: If arrogance is the heady wine of youth  then humility must be its eternal hangover.
author: Helen Van Slyke

quote: Conquer but never triumph.
author: Marie von Ebner-Eschenbach

quote: Only so far as a man believes strongly  mightily  can he act cheerfully  or do anything worth doing.
author: Frederick W. Robertson

quote: Experience tells you what to do  confidence allows you to do it.
author: Stan Smith

quote: Your success depends mainly upon what you think of yourself and whether you believe in yourself.
author: William J. H. Boetcker

quote: Success can make you go one of two ways. It can make you a prima donna  or it can smooth the edges  take away the insecurities  let the nice things come out.
author: Barbara Walters

quote: Humility is attentive patience.
author: Simone Weil

quote: The man who cannot believe in himself cannot believe in anything else.
author: Roy L. Smith

quote: A man cannot be comfortable without his own approval.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Believe that you can whip the enemy  and you have won half the battle.
author: General J. E. B. Stuart

quote: As is our confidence  so is our capacity.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: Such to me is the new image of aging  growth in self  and service for all mankind.
author: Ethel Percy Andrus

quote: The older I get  the greater power I seem to have to help the world  I am like a snowball-the further I am rolled  the more I gain.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: The real evidence of growing older is that things level off in importance.
author: Gladys Taber

quote: It is sad to grow old but nice to ripen.
author: Brigitte Bardot

quote: Oh  yes. I'd do it all again  the spirit is willing yet  I feel the same desire to do the work but the flesh is weak. It's too bad that our bodies wear out while our interests are just as strong as ever.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: I'm not interested in age. People who tell me their age are silly. You're as old as you feel.
author: Elizabeth Arden

quote: It is sad to grow old  but nice to ripen.
author: Brigitte Bardot

quote: Maturity is coming to terms with that other part of yourself.
author: Dr. Ruth Tiffany Barnhouse

quote: I believe the true function of age is memory. I'm recording as fast as I can.
author: Rita Mae Brown

quote: A woman's always younger than a man of equal years.
author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

quote: It is often the case with finer natures  that when the fire of the spirit dies out with increasing age  the power of the intellect is unaltered or increased.
author: Margaret Gatty

quote: I'm like old wine. They don't bring me out very often  but I'm well preserved.
author: Rose Fitzgerald Kennedy

quote: The great thing about getting older is that you don't lose all the other ages you've been.
author: Madeleine L'Engle

quote: Perhaps middle age is  or should be  a period of shedding shells  the shell of ambition  the shell of material accumulations and possessions  the shell of the ego.
author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

quote: Age is totally unimportant. The years are really irrelevant. It's how you cope with them.
author: Shirley Lord

quote: We are always the same age inside.
author: Gertrude Stein

quote: There is a fountain of youth: it is your mind  your talents  the creativity you bring to your life and the lives of the people you love. When you learn to tap this source  you will truly have defeated age.
author: Sophia Loren

quote: I am much younger now than I was at twelve or anyway  less burdened.
author: Flannery O'Connor

quote: There are no old people nowadays  they are either "wonderful for their age" or dead.
author: Mary Pettibone Poole

quote: For inside all the weakness of old age  the spirit  God knows  is as mercurial as it ever was.
author: May Sarton

quote: Age puzzles me. I thought it was a quiet time. My seventies were interesting and fairly serene  but my eighties are passionate. I grow more intense as I age.
author: Florida Scott-Maxwell

quote: We who are old know that age is more than a disability. It is an intense and varied experience  almost beyond our capacity at times  but something to be carried high.
author: Florida Scott-Maxwell

quote: Character contributes to beauty. It fortifies a woman as her youth fades. A mode of conduct  a standard of courage  discipline  fortitude and integrity can do a great deal to make a woman beautiful.
author: Jacqueline Bisset

quote: Be on the alert to recognize your prime at whatever time of your life it may occur.
author: Muriel Spark

quote: Women may be the one group that grows more radical with age.
author: Gloria Steinem

quote: So much has been said and sung of beautiful young girls  why doesn't somebody wake up to the beauty of old women?
author: Harriet Beecher Stowe

quote: Old age is that night of life  as night is the old age of day. Still night is full of magnificence and  for many  it is more brilliant than the day.
author: Anne-Sophie Swetchine

quote: In youth we learn  in age we understand.
author: Marie von Ebner-Eschenbach

quote: Change excites me. I am fifty years old. It's when the mind catches up with the body.
author: Raquel Welch

quote: Don't buy the garbage that you're over the hill at fifty. This country makes such a big thing about age  particularly if you're a woman. What I think is relevant is your experience  what you have to offer. I hope people will recognize that and keep going.
author: Molly Yard

quote: I refuse to admit that I am more than fifty-two  even if that does make my sons illegitimate.
author: Nancy Astor

quote: I used to dread getting older because I thought I would not be able to do all the things I wanted to do  but now that I am older I find that I don't want to do them.
author: Nancy Astor

quote: I am immortal! I know it! I feel it!
author: Margaret Witter Fuller

quote: Another belief of mine: that everyone else my age is an adult  whereas I am merely in disguise.
author: Margaret Atwood

quote: I think your whole life shows in your face and you should be proud of that.
author: Lauren Bacall

quote: Youth is not a time of life  it is a state of mind. You are as old as your doubt  your fear  your despair. The way to keep young is to keep your faith young. Keep your self-confidence young. Keep your hope young.
author: Luella F. Phean

quote: We Can't Afford to Doubt Ourselves I have become my own version of an optimist. If I can't make it through one door  I'll go through another door-or I'll make a door. Something terrific will come no matter how dark the present.
author: Joan Rivers

quote: Our doubts are traitors  and make us lose the good we oft might win  by fearing to attempt.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Doubt indulged soon becomes doubt realized.
author: Frances Ridley Havergal

quote: Kill the snake of doubt in your soul  crush the worms of fear in your heart  and mountains will move out of your way.
author: Kate Seredy

quote: A man's doubts and fears are his worst enemies.
author: William Wrigley

quote: Doubt whom you will  but never yourself.
author: Christian Bovee

quote: I have never been nervous in all my life and I have no patience with people who are. If you know what you are going to do  you have no reason to be nervous. And I knew what I was going to do.
author: Mary Garden

quote: Our self-conceit sustains  and always must sustain us.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: Self-distrust is the cause of most of our failures ... they are the weakest  however strong  who have no faith in themselves or their own powers.
author: Christian Bovee

quote: Faith in oneself ... is the best and safest course.
author: Michelangelo

quote: Strong people don't need strong leaders.
author: Ella Baker

quote: Might  could  would-they are contemptible auxiliaries.
author: George Eliot

quote: You've got to take the initiative and play your game ... confidence makes the difference.
author: Chris Evert

quote: Shyness is just egotism out of its depth.
author: Penelope Keith

quote: Self-trust is the first secret of success.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Self-confidence is the first requisite to great undertakings.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: I felt a comedy ego beginning to grow  which gave me the courage to begin tentatively looking into myself for material.
author: Joan Rivers

quote: My mother taught me very early to believe I could achieve any accomplishment I wanted to. The first was to walk without braces.
author: Wilma Rudolph

quote: If there be a faith that can move mountains  it is faith in one's own power.
author: Marie von Ebner-Eschenbach

quote: They are able because they think they are able.
author: Virgil

quote: Nothing splendid has ever been achieved except by those who dared believe that something inside them was superior to circumstances.
author: Bruce Barton

quote: Confidence is that feeling by which the mind embarks on great and honorable courses with a sure hope and trust in itself.
author: Cicero

quote: One's self-image is very important because if that's in good shape  then you can do anything  or practically anything.
author: Sir John Gielgud

quote: I've never had a humble opinion in my life. If you're going to have one  why bother to be humble about it?
author: Joan Baez

quote: They conquer who believe they can.
author: John Dryden

quote: The big gap between the ability of actors is confidence.
author: Kathleen Turner

quote: Women who are confident of their abilities are more likely to succeed than those who lack confidence  even though the latter may be much more competent and talented and industrious.
author: Dr. Joyce Brothers

quote: Search and you will find that at the base and birth of every great business organization was an enthusiast  a man consumed with earnestness of purpose  with confidence in his powers  with faith in the worthwhileness of his endeavors.
author: B. C. Forbes

quote: Self-reverence  self-knowledge  self-control. These three alone lead to sovereign power.
author: Alfred, Lord Tennyson

quote: Optimism is the faith that leads to achievement. Nothing can be done without hope and confidence.
author: Helen Keller

quote: Confidence imparts a wonderful inspiration to its possessor.
author: John Milton

quote: Great poetry is always written by somebody straining to go beyond what he can do.
author: Stephen Spender

quote: Immense power is acquired by assuring yourself in your secret reveries that you were born to control affairs.
author: Andrew Carnegie

quote: If one advances confidently in the direction of his dreams  and endeavors to live the life which he has imagined  he will meet with a success unexpected in common hours.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: The confidence which we have in ourselves gives birth to much of that which we have in others.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quote: The way in which we think of ourselves has everything to do with how our world sees us.
author: Arlene Raven

quote: Once you get rid of the idea that you must please other people before you please yourself  and you begin to follow your own instincts-only then can you be successful. You become more satisfied  and when you are other people tend to be satisfied by what you do.
author: Raquel Welch

quote: Ideal conversation must be an exchange of thought  and not  as many of those who worry about their shortcomings believe  an eloquent exhibition of wit or oratory.
author: Emily Post

quote: There is overwhelming evidence that the higher the level of self-esteem  the more likely one will treat others with respect  kindness  and generosity. People who do not experience self-love have little or no capacity to love others.
author: Nathaniel Branden

quote: Nobody holds a good opinion of a man who has a low opinion of himself.
author: Anthony Trollope

quote: Only the person who has faith in himself is able to be faithful to others.
author: Erich Fromm

quote: He can inspire a group only if he himself is filled with confidence and hope of success.
author: Floyd V. Filson

quote: A good sweat  with the blood pounding through my body  makes me feel alive  revitalized. I gain a sense of mastery and assurance. I feel good about myself. Then I can feel good about others.
author: Arthur Dobrin

quote: Nothing is a greater impediment to being on good terms with others than being ill at ease with yourself.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: Measure yourself by your best moments  not by your worst. We are too prone to judge ourselves by our moments of despondency and depression.
author: Robert Johnson

quote: Oftentimes nothing profits more than self-esteem  grounded on what is just and right and well-managed.
author: John Milton

quote: Confidence ... is directness and courage in meeting the facts of life.
author: John Dewey

quote: The gain in self-confidence of having accomplished a tiresome labour is immense.
author: Arnold Bennett

quote: The way to develop self-confidence is to do the thing you fear and get a record of successful experiences behind you.
author: William Jennings Bryan

quote: Believe that with your feelings and your work you are taking part in the greatest  the more strongly you cultivate this belief  the more will reality and the world go forth from it.
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

quote: Class is an aura of confidence that is being sure without being cocky. Class has nothing to do with money. Class never runs scared. It is self-discipline and self-knowledge. It's the sure-footedness that comes with having proved you can meet life.
author: Ann Landers

quote: In forty hours I shall be in battle  with little information  and on the spur of the moment will have to make the most momentous decisions  but I believe that one's spirit enlarges with responsibility and that  with God's help  I shall make them and make them right.
author: General George S. Patton

quote: Be always sure you're right  then go ahead.
author: Davy Crockett

quote: I always thought I should be treated like a star.
author: Madonna

quote: Perhaps I am stronger than I think.
author: Thomas Merton

quote: The ability to take pride in your own work is one of the hallmarks of sanity.
author: Nikki Giovanni

quote: Confidence is contagious. So is lack of confidence.
author: Vince Lombardi

quote: "Glamour" is assurance. It is a kind of knowing that you are all right in every way  mentally and physically and in appearance  and that  whatever the occasion or the situation  you are equal to it.
author: Marlene Dietrich

quote: Never bend your head. Hold it high. Look the world straight in the eye.
author: Helen Keller

quote: To be confident is to act in faith.
author: Bernard Bynion

quote: Skill and confidence are an uncon-quered army.
author: George Herbert

quote: You must learn to be still in the midst of activity  and to be vibrantly alive in repose.
author: Indira Gandhi

quote: When the fight begins within himself  a man's worth something.
author: Robert Browning

quote: To put a tempting face aside when duty demands every faculty is a lesson which takes most men longest to learn.
author: Gertrude Atherton

quote: Lack of discipline leads to frustration and self-loathing.
author: Marie Chapian

quote: You must have discipline to have fun.
author: Julia Child

quote: Self-command is the main elegance.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: A little kingdom I possess  Where thoughts and feelings dwell  And very hard the task I find Of governing it well.
author: Louisa May Alcott

quote: Everybody's business is nobody's business  and nobody's business is my business.
author: Clara Barton

quote: I listen and give input only if somebody asks.
author: Barbara Bush

quote: The man who masters his own soul will forever be called conqueror of conquerors.
author: Plautus

quote: Temptations come  as a general rule  when they are sought.
author: Margaret Oliphant

quote: A mind which really lays hold of a subject is not easily detached from it.
author: Ida Tarbell

quote: There is little that can withstand a man who can conquer himself.
author: Louis XIV

quote: Too often in ironing out trouble someone gets scorched.
author: Marcelene Cox

quote: When you borrow trouble you give your peace of mind as security.
author: Myrtle Reed

quote: Don't be curious of matters that don't concern you  never speak of them  and don't ask about them.
author: Teresa of Avila

quote: I will write of him who fights and vanquishes his sins  who struggles on through weary years against himself ... and wins.
author: Caroline Begelow LeRow

quote: What we do upon some great occasion will probably depend on what we already are  and what we are will be the result of previous years of self-discipline.
author: H. P. Liddon

quote: Man who man would be  must rule the empire of himself.
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote: He that hath no rule over his own spirit is like a city that is broken down  and without walls.
author: Bible

quote: Most powerful is he who has himself in his own power.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: It goes without saying that you should never have more children than you have car windows.
author: Erma Bombeck

quote: If you can't write your message in a sentence  you can't say it in an hour.
author: Dianna Booher

quote: Sweet words are like honey  a little may refresh  but too much gluts the stomach.
author: Anne Bradstreet

quote: I am  indeed  a king  because I know how to rule myself.
author: Pietro Aretino

quote: He who conquers others is strong  he who conquers himself is mighty.
author: Lao-Tzu

quote: A woman that's too soft and sweet is like tapioca pudding-fine for them as likes it.
author: Osa Johnson

quote: A little of what you fancy does you good.
author: Marie Lloyd

quote: Gammy used to say  "Too much scrubbing takes the life right out of things."
author: Betty MacDonald

quote: Who is apt  on occasion  to assign a multitude of reasons when one will do? This is a sure sign of weakness in argument.
author: Harriet Martineau

quote: The point of good writing is knowing when to stop.
author: L. M. Montgomery

quote: Superior people never make long visits.
author: Marianne Moore

quote: The longest absence is less perilous to love than the terrible trials of incessant proximity.
author: Ouida

quote: Never eat more than you can lift.
author: Miss Piggy

quote: What lies in our power to do  it lies in our power not to do.
author: Aristotle

quote: It isn't until you come to a spiritual understanding of who you are-not necessarily a religious feeling  but deep down  the spirit within-that you can begin to take control.
author: Oprah Winfrey

quote: Anger is only one letter short of danger.
author: Anonymous

quote: Without discipline  there's no life at all.
author: Katharine Hepburn

quote: Self-control is the quality that distinguishes the fittest to survive.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Many people have the ambition to succeed  they may even have a special aptitude for their job. And yet they do not move ahead. Why? Perhaps they think that since they can master the job  there is no need to master themselves.
author: John Stevenson

quote: Waiting is one of the great arts.
author: Margery Allingham

quote: Never fail to know that if you are doing all the talking  you are boring somebody.
author: Helen Gurley Brown

quote: I know too well the poison and the sting Of things too sweet.
author: Adelaide Proctor

quote: Would that there were an award for people who come to understand the concept of enough. Good enough. Successful enough. Thin enough. Rich enough. Socially responsible enough. When you have self-respect you have enough.
author: Gail Sheehy

quote: Transformation also means looking for ways to stop pushing yourself so hard professionally or inviting so much stress.
author: Gail Sheehy

quote: To wear your heart on your sleeve isn't a very good plan  you should wear it inside  where it functions best.
author: Margaret Thatcher

quote: For fast-acting relief try slowing down.
author: Lily Tomlin

quote: This is the gist of what I know: Give advice and buy a foe.
author: Phyllis McGinley

quote: Don't give advice unless you're asked.
author: Amy Alcott

quote: We don't want to push our ideas on to customers  we simply want to make what they want.
author: Laura Ashley

quote: The passion for setting people right is in itself an afflictive disease.
author: Marianne Moore

quote: There is only one corner of the universe you can be certain of improving  and that's your own self.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: He that hath no rule over his own spirit is like a city that is broken down and without walls.
author: Taylor Caldwell

quote: Not being able to govern events  I govern myself.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: As far as your self-control goes  as far goes your freedom.
author: Marie von Ebner-Eschenbach

quote: That is always our problem  not how to get control of people  but how all together we can get control of a situation.
author: Mary Parker Follett

quote: There is no hierarchy of values by which one culture has the right to insist on all its own values and deny those of another.
author: Margaret Mead

quote: He that would govern others should first be the master of himself.
author: Philip Massinger

quote: You've got to ensure that the holders of an opinion  however unpopular  are allowed to put across their points of view.
author: Betty Boothroyd

quote: There is space within sisterhood for likeness and difference  for the subtle differences that challenge and delight  there is space for disappointment- and surprise.
author: Christine Downing

quote: The highest result of education is tolerance.
author: Helen Keller

quote: In a society where the rights and potential of women are constrained  no man can be truly free. He may have power  but he will not have freedom.
author: Mary F. Robinson

quote: Ambition  old as mankind  the immemorial weakness of the strong.
author: Vita Sackville-West

quote: When one clings to the myth of superiority  one must constantly overlook the virtues and abilities of others.
author: Anne Wilson Schaef

quote: The desire to conquer is itself a sort of subjection.
author: George Eliot

quote: The only people who would be in government are those who care more about people than they do about power.
author: Millicent Fenwick

quote: Leaders can be moral-and they should be moral-without imposing their morality on others.
author: Geraldine Ferraro

quote: The fool shouts loudly  thinking to impress the world.
author: Marie de France

quote: Blessed is the man who  having nothing to say  abstains from giving wordy evidence of the fact.
author: George Eliot

quote: It was enough just to sit there without words.
author: Louise Erdrich

quote: Talking too much  too soon  and with too much self-satisfaction has always seemed to me a sure way to court disaster.
author: Meg Greenfield

quote: A story is told as much by silence as by speech.
author: Susan Griffin

quote: Talk uses up ideas. ... Once I have spoken them aloud  they are lost to me  dissipated into the noisy air like smoke. Only if I bury them  like bulbs  in the rich soil of silence do they grow.
author: Doris Grumbach

quote: Next to entertaining or impressive talk  a thoroughgoing silence manages to intrigue most people.
author: Florence Hurst Harriman

quote: Love understands love  it needs no talk.
author: Frances Ridley Havergal

quote: I like people who refuse to speak until they are ready to speak.
author: Lillian Hellman

quote: The strokes of the pen need deliberation as much as the sword needs swiftness.
author: Julia Ward Howe

quote: Handle them carefully  for words have more power than atom bombs.
author: Pearl Strachan Hurd

quote: One sees intelligence far more than one hears it. People do not always say transcendental things  but if they are capable of saying them  it is always visible.
author: Marie Leneru

quote: The silence of a man who loves to praise is a censure sufficiently severe.
author: Charlotte Lennox

quote: Silence is one of the great arts of conversation.
author: Hannah Moore

quote: Silence and reserve will give anyone a reputation for wisdom.
author: Myrtle Reed

quote: It is impossible to persuade a man who does not disagree  but smiles.
author: Muriel Spark

quote: All the feeling which my father could not put into words was in his hand- any dog  child  or horse would recognize the kindness of it.
author: Freya Stark

quote: Nothing could bother me more than the way a thing goes dead once it has been said.
author: Gertrude Stein

quote: Minimum information given with maximum politeness.
author: Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis

quote: A gossip is one who talks to you about others  a bore is one who talks to you about himself  and a brilliant conversationalist is one who talks to you about yourself.
author: Lisa Kirk

quote: Beware of allowing a tactless word  rebuttal  a rejection to obliterate the whole sky.
author: Anais Nin

quote: Violence of the tongue is very real- sharper than any knife.
author: Mother Teresa

quote: Don't confuse being stimulating with being blunt.
author: Barbara Walters

quote: The less said the better.
author: Jane Austen

quote: No man is free who is not master of himself.
author: Epictetus

quote: You were once wild here. Don't let them tame you!
author: Isadora Duncan

quote: Freedom is not procured by a full enjoyment of what is desired  but by controlling that desire.
author: Epictetus

quote: The happiness of a man in this life does not consist in the absence  but in the mastery  of his passions.
author: Lord Alfred Tennyson

quote: When we start deceiving ourselves into thinking not that we want something or need something  not that it is a pragmatic necessity for us to have it  but that it is a moral imperative that we have it. Then is when we join the fashionable madmen  and then is when the thin whine of hysteria is heard in the land  and then is when we are in bad trouble.
author: Joan Didion

quote: I count him braver who overcomes his desires than him who conquers his enemies  the hardest victory is the victory over self.
author: Aristotle

quote: The basic difference between being assertive and being aggressive is how our words and behavior affect the rights and well-being of others.
author: Sharon Anthony Bower

quote: The strong man is the one who is able to intercept at will the communication between the senses and the mind.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: He that would be superior to external influences must first become superior to his own passions.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: He who reigns within himself and rules his passions  desires  and fears is more than a king.
author: John Milton

quote: To pursue yourself is an interesting and absorbing thing to do. Once you have caught the scent of a hidden being  your own hidden being  you won't readily be deflected from the tracking down of it.
author: Cynthia Propper Seton

quote: Ninety percent of the world's woe comes from people not knowing themselves  their abilities  their frailties  and even their real virtues. Most of us go almost all the way through life as complete strangers to ourselves.
author: Sydney J. Harris

quote: If I could know me  I could know the universe.
author: Shirley MacLaine

quote: A man who knows he is a fool is not a great fool.
author: Chuang-tzu

quote: I believe that in our constant search for security we can never gain any peace of mind until we are secure in our own soul.
author: Margaret Chase Smith

quote: We should know what our convictions are  and stand for them. Upon one's own philosophy  conscious or unconscious  depends one's ultimate interpretation of facts. Therefore it is wise to be as clear as possible about one's subjective principles. As the man is  so will be his ultimate truth.
author: Carl Jung

quote: Femininity appears to be one of those pivotal qualities that is so important no one can define it.
author: Caroline Bird

quote: I knew what my job was  it was to go out and meet the people and love them.
author: Diana, Princess of Wales

quote: People who concentrate on giving good service always get more personal satisfaction as well as better business. How can we get better service? One way is by trying to see ourselves as others do.
author: Patricia Fripp

quote: Resolve to be thyself  and know that he who finds himself  loses his misery.
author: Matthew Arnold

quote: Let us remember that within us there is a palace of immense magnificence.
author: Teresa of Avila

quote: Many men go fishing all of their lives without knowing that it is not fish they are after.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Freedom is knowing who you really are.
author: Linda Thomson

quote: If you do not tell the truth about yourself you cannot tell it about other people.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: To understand is to forgive  even oneself.
author: Alexander Chase

quote: Knowing others is wisdom  knowing yourself is Enlightenment.
author: Lao-Tzu

quote: I think self-awareness is probably the most important thing towards becoming a champion.
author: Billie Jean King

quote: The life which is unexamined is not worth living.
author: Plato

quote: The deeper interior you have the more you have in your library.
author: Jacqueline Bisset

quote: Follow your interests  get the best available education and training  set your sights high  be persistent  be flexible  keep your options open  accept help when offered  and be prepared to help others.
author: Mildred Spiewak Dresselhaus

quote: It's all to do with the training: you can do a lot if you're properly trained.
author: Queen Elizabeth II

quote: As it turns out  social scientists have established only one fact about single women's mental health: employment improves it.
author: Susan Faludi

quote: Saying "yes" to yourself means acknowledging what you have that's good and working on the things that aren't.
author: Patricia Fripp

quote: There is no good reason why we should not develop and change until the last day we live.
author: Karen Horney

quote: We can't take any credit for our talents. It's how we use them that counts.
author: Madeleine L'Engle

quote: As simple as it sounds  we all must try to be the best person we can: by making the best choices  by making the most of the talents we've been given.
author: Mary Lou Retton

quote: What is most beautiful in virile men is something feminine  what is most beautiful in feminine women is something masculine.
author: Susan Sontag

quote: You must love and care for yourself  because that's when the best comes out.
author: Tina Turner

quote: Show me a sensible person who likes himself or herself! I know myself too well to like what I see. I know but too well that I'm not what I'd like to be.
author: Golda Meir

quote: Until we can understand the assumptions in which we are drenched we cannot know ourselves.
author: Adrienne Rich

quote: Experience isn't interesting till it begins to repeat itself-in fact  till it does that  it hardly is experience.
author: Elizabeth Bowen

quote: Self-knowledge is the beginning of self-improvement.
author: Spanish proverb

quote: We are the same people as we were at three  six  ten or twenty years old. More noticeably so  perhaps  at six or seven  because we were not pretending so much then.
author: Agatha Christie

quote: Until we see what we are  we cannot take steps to become what we should be.
author: Charlotte P. Gilman

quote: When a man begins to understand himself  he begins to live.
author: Norvin G. McGranahan

quote: A humble knowledge of oneself is a surer road to God than a deep searching of the sciences.
author: Thomas a Kempis

quote: If you do not ask yourself what it is you know  you will go on listening to others and change will not come because you will not hear your own truth.
author: Saint Bartholomew

quote: No man remains quite what he was when he recognizes himself.
author: Thomas Mann

quote: Sometimes a person has to go back  really back-to have a sense  an understanding of all that's gone to make them-before they can go forward.
author: Paule Marshall

quote: Awakening begins when a man realizes that he is going nowhere and does not know where to go.
author: Georges Gurdjieff

quote: Self-searching is the means by which we bring new vision  action  and grace to bear upon the dark and negative side of our natures. With it comes the development of that kind of humility that makes it possible for us to receive God's help. ... We find that bit by bit we can discard the old life-the one that did not work-for a new life that can and does work under conditions whatever.
author: Anonymous

quote: The most difficult thing in life is to know yourself.
author: Thales

quote: You never find yourself until you face the truth.
author: Pearl Bailey

quote: It is not only the most difficult thing to know oneself  but the most inconvenient  too.
author: Josh Billings

quote: Long ago I understood that it wasn't merely my being a woman that was preventing my being welcomed into the world of what I long thought of as my peers. It was that I had succeeded in an undertaking few men have even attempted: I have become myself.
author: Alice Koller

quote: He knows the universe and does not know himself.
author: Jean de la Fontaine

quote: There are chapters in every life which are seldom read and certainly not aloud.
author: Carol Shields

quote: No man ever understands quite his own artful dodges to escape from the grim shadow of self-knowledge.
author: Joseph Conrad

quote: Nothing is easier than self-deceit.
author: Demosthenes

quote: Sometimes it takes years to really grasp what has happened to your life.
author: Wilma Rudolph

quote: One may understand the cosmos  but never the ego  the self is more distant than any star.
author: G. K. Chesterton

quote: You can live a lifetime and  at the end of it  know more about other people than you know about yourself.
author: Beryl Markham

quote: Learn what you are  and be such.
author: Pindar

quote: Long tresses down to the floor can be beautiful  if you have that  but learn to love what you have.
author: Anita Baker

quote: I am no longer what I was. I will remain what I have become.
author: Coco Chanel

quote: I always introduce myself as an encyclopedia of defects which I do not deny. Why should I? It took me a whole life to build myself as I am.
author: Oriana Fallaci

quote: The happy man is he who knows his limitations  yet bows to no false gods.
author: Robert W. Service

quote: I shall be an autocrat  that's my trade  and the good Lord will forgive me  that's his.
author: Catherine the Great

quote: Sometimes it is more important to discover what one cannot do  than what one can.
author: Lin Yutang

quote: Somehow we learn who we really are and then live with that decision.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: Self-understanding rather than self-condemnation is the way to inner peace and mature conscience.
author: Joshua L. Liebman

quote: To say something nice about themselves  this is the hardest thing in the world for people to do.
author: Nancy Friday

quote: After my screen test  the director clapped his hands gleefully and yelled  "She can't talk! She can't act! She's sensational!"
author: Ava Gardner

quote: Whenever I dwell for any length of time on my own shortcomings  they gradually begin to seem mild  harmless  rather engaging little things  not at all like the staring defects in other people's characters.
author: Margaret Halsey

quote: It's not our disadvantages or shortcomings that are ridiculous  but rather the studious way we try to hide them  and our desire to act as if they did not exist.
author: Giacomo Leopardi

quote: Of all the idiots I have met in my life  and the Lord knows that they have not been few or little  I think that I have been the biggest.
author: Isak Dinesen

quote: A woman of mystique is fully aware of her flaws and weaknesses  yet she is strong enough to admit them and not be embarrassed by them.
author: Jean Lush

quote: Learning too soon our limitations  we never learn our powers.
author: Mignon McLaughlin

quote: Your thorns are the best part of you.
author: Marianne Moore

quote: Oh  I'm so inadequate. And I love myself!
author: Meg Ryan

quote: I am simple  complex  generous  selfish  unattractive  beautiful  lazy  and driven.
author: Barbra Streisand

quote: If your head tells you one thing and your heart tells you another  before you do anything  you should first decide whether you have a better head or a better heart.
author: Marilyn vos Savant

quote: I did not lose myself all at once. I rubbed out my face over the years washing away my pain  the same way carvings on stone are worn down by water.
author: Amy Tan

quote: The precept  "Know yourself " was not solely intended to obviate the pride of mankind  but likewise that we might understand our own worth.
author: Cicero

quote: I believe that dreams transport us through the underside of our days  and that if we wish to become acquainted with the dark side of what we are  the signposts are there  waiting for us to translate them.
author: Gail Godwin

quote: It is a purely relative matter where one draws the plimsoll-line of condemnation  and ... if you find the whole of humanity falls below it you have simply made a mistake and drawn it too high. And you are probably below it yourself.
author: Frances Partridge

quote: I'm a salami writer. I try to write good salami  but salami is salami.
author: Stephen King

quote: Only by pursuing the extremes in one's nature  with all its contradictions  appetites  aversions  rages  can one hope to understand a little ... oh  I admit only a very little ... of what life is about.
author: Francoise Sagan

quote: The basic experience of everyone is the experience of human limitation.
author: Flannery O'Connor

quote: We do not make beams from the hollow  decaying trunk of the fallen oak. We use the upsoaring tree in the full vigor of its sap.
author: Sylvia Pankhurst

quote: We must use what we have to invent what we desire.
author: Adrienne Rich

quote: Whatever glory belongs to the race for a development unprecedented in history for the given length of time  a full share belongs to the womanhood of the race.
author: Mary McLeod Bethune

quote: There is a potential heroine in every woman.
author: Jean Shinoda Bolen

quote: We are volcanoes. When we women offer our experience as our truth  as human truth  all the maps change. There are new mountains.
author: Ursula K. LeGuin

quote: I hear the singing of the lives of women. The clear mystery  the offering  the pride.
author: Muriel Rukeyser

quote: The sexes in each species of beings . . . are always true equivalents-equals but not identicals.
author: Antoinette Brown Blackwell

quote: For women there are  undoubtedly  great difficulties in the path  but so much the more to overcome. First no woman would say "I am but a woman!" But a woman! What more can you ask to be?
author: Maria Mitchell

quote: Ability is sexless.
author: Christabel Pankhurst

quote: We bear the world and we make it.... There was never a great man who had not a great mother-it is hardly an exaggeration.
author: Olive Schreiner

quote: Remember  Ginger Rogers did everything Fred Astaire did  but she did it backwards and in high heels.
author: Faith Whittlesey

quote: There may be ways in which we can work for change. We don't have to do dramatic things or devote our entire lives to it. We can lead normal lives but at the same time try hard not to be bystanders.
author: Helen Bamber

quote: Some people give time  some money  some their skills and connections  some literally give their life's blood . . . but everyone has something to give.
author: Barbara Bush

quote: Though I have no productive worth  I have a certain value as an indestructible quantity.
author: Alice James

quote: I was once the typical daughter  then the easily recognizable wife  and then the quintessential mother. I seem always to have reminded people of someone in their family. Perhaps I am just the triumph of Plain Jane.
author: Helen Hayes

quote: God wastes nothing.
author: Jan Karon

quote: To be a housewife is ... a difficult  a wrenching  sometimes ungrateful job if it's looked on as only a job. Regarded as a profession  it is the noblest as it is the most ancient of the catalogue. Let none persuade us differently  or the world will be lost indeed.
author: Phyllis McGinley

quote: It's this no-nonsense side of women that is pleasant to deal with. They are the real sportsmen.
author: Phyllis McGinley

quote: Not being beautiful was the true blessing. ... Not being beautiful forced me to develop my inner resources. The pretty girl has a handicap to overcome.
author: Golda Meir

quote: There is not one big cosmic meaning for all  there is only the meaning we each give to our life  an individual meaning  an individual plot  like an individual novel  a book for each person.
author: Anais Nin

quote: I see myself as Rhoda  not Mary Tyler Moore.
author: Rosie O'Donnell

quote: The surest sign of fitness is success.
author: Olive Schreiner

quote: From the first  I made my learning  what little it was  useful every way I could.
author: Mary McLeod Bethune

quote: I was not a classic mother. But my kids were never palmed off to boarding school. So  I didn't bake cookies. You can buy cookies  but you can't buy love.
author: Raquel Welch

quote: I am an ordinary person  but carried to extremes.
author: Fay Weldon

quote: I am not a glutton-I am an explorer of food.
author: Erma Bombeck

quote: I'm just a person trapped inside a woman's body.
author: Elayne Boosler

quote: To know oneself  one should assert oneself.
author: Albert Camus

quote: I am because my little dog knows me.
author: Gertrude Stein

quote: There is a solitude which each and every one of us has always carried within. More inaccessible than the ice-cold mountains  more profound than the midnight sea: the solitude of self.
author: Elizabeth Cady Stanton

quote: Whether it was work  marriage  or family  I've always been a late bloomer.
author: Sigourney Weaver

quote: Rebellion against your handicaps gets you nowhere. Self-pity gets you nowhere. One must have the adventurous daring to accept oneself as a bundle of possibilities and undertake the most interesting game in the world-making the most of one's best.
author: Harry Emerson Fosdick

quote: I want  by understanding myself  to understand others. I want to be all that I am capable of becoming.
author: Katherine Mansfield

quote: Real apprenticeship is ultimately always to the self.
author: Cynthia Ozick

quote: The delights of self-discovery are always available.
author: Gail Sheehy

quote: Whether there are innately female leadership styles ... is not really the right question. It is more important to ask why there has been so little attention paid to women leaders over the years as well as why the styles of leading more often exhibited by women are particularly useful at this critical moment in history.
author: Charlotte Bunch

quote: In other living creatures the ignorance of themselves is nature  but in men it is a vice.
author: Boethius

quote: Once  power was considered a masculine attribute. In fact  power has no sex.
author: Katherine Graham

quote: It is doubtless a vice to turn one's eyes inward too much  but I am my own comedy and tragedy.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: I write entirely to find out what I'm thinking  what I'm looking at  what I see and what it means  what I want  and what I fear.
author: Joan Didion

quote: Many people today don't want honest answers insofar as honest means unpleasant or disturbing. They want a soft answer that turneth away anxiety.
author: Louis Kronenberger

quote: A single event can awaken within us a stranger totally unknown to us.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quote: No one can figure out your worth but you.
author: Pearl Bailey

quote: There is no disappointment we endure one-half so great as what we are to ourselves.
author: Philip James Bailey

quote: He who knows himself best esteems himself least.
author: H. G. Bohn

quote: Thales was asked what was most difficult to man  he answered: "To know one's self."
author: Diogenes

quote: Oh  wad some power the giftie gie us To see oursels as ithers see us! It wad frae monie a blunder free us  And foolish notion.
author: Robert Burns

quote: We know what we are  but know not what we may be.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: He was like a cock who thought the sun had risen to hear him crow.
author: George Eliot

quote: He that falls in love with himself will have no rivals.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Self-love is the greatest of all flatterers.
author: La Rochefoucauld

quote: All men love themselves.
author: Plautus

quote: I to myself am dearer than a friend.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: To love one's self is the beginning of a life-long romance.
author: Wilde Self-Made

quote: He is a self-made man  and worships his creator.
author: John Bright

quote: Every man is the architect of his own fortune.
author: English proverb

quote: Self-pity comes so naturally to all of us.
author: Andre Maurois

quote: Every man supposes himself not to be fully understood or appreciated.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Self-pity is our worst enemy and if we yield to it  we can never do anything wise in this world.
author: Helen Keller

quote: What poison is to food  self-pity is to life.
author: Oliver C. Wilson

quote: It's odd that you can get so anesthetized by your own pain or your own problem that you don't quite fully share the hell of someone close to you.
author: Lady Bird Johnson

quote: Grumbling is the death of love.
author: Marlene Dietrich

quote: Being sorry for myself is a luxury I can't afford.
author: Stephen King

quote: To feel sorry for oneself is one of the most disintegrating things the individual can do to himself.
author: Winifred Rhoades

quote: Self-pity is one of the most dangerous forms of self-centeredness. It fogs our vision.
author: Anonymous

quote: To hear complaints is wearisome to the wretched and the happy alike.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Sympathy is never wasted except when you give it to yourself.
author: John W. Raper

quote: The opposite of having faith is having self-pity.
author: Og Guinness

quote: Optimism and self-pity are the positive and negative poles of modern cowardice.
author: Cyril Connolly

quote: He who complains  sins.
author: Saint Francis de Sales

quote: This life is not for complaint  but for satisfaction.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Is life so wretched? Isn't it rather your hands which are too small  your vision which is muddled? You are the one who must grow up.
author: Dag Hammarskjold

quote: There is only one way to end a self-pity cycle: stop comparing yourself to others  and simply follow Christ.
author: Linda Harry

quote: Suffering isn't ennobling  recovery is.
author: Christian N. Barnard

quote: You can overcome anything if you don't bellyache.
author: Bernard M. Baruch

quote: There is only one way to end a self-pity cycle: stop comparing yourself to others  and simply follow Christ.
author: Linda Harry

quote: Do not weep  do not wax indignant. Understand.
author: Baruch Spinoza

quote: When any fit of gloominess  or perversion of mind  lays hold upon you  make it a rule not to publish it by complaints.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: The secret of being miserable is to have leisure to bother about whether you are happy or not. The cure for it is occupation.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: The cure for grief is motion.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: I got the blues thinking of the future  so I left off and made some marmalade. It's amazing how it cheers one up to shred oranges or scrub the floor.
author: D. H. Lawrence

quote: When you find yourself overpowered  as it were  by melancholy  the best way is to go out and do something.
author: John Keble

quote: The best mask for demoralization is daring.
author: Lucan

quote: Self-pity is a death that has no resurrection  a sinkhole from which no rescuing hand can drag you because you have chosen to sink.
author: Elizabeth Elliot

quote: Pain is inevitable. Suffering is optional.
author: Anonymous

quote: I am convinced  the longer I live  that life and its blessings are not so entirely unjustly distributed as when we are suffering greatly we are inclined to suppose.
author: Mary Todd Lincoln

quote: Despair is the absolute extreme of self-love. It is reached when a man deliberately turns his back on all help from anyone else in order to taste the rotten luxury of knowing himself to be lost.
author: Thomas Morton

quote: Our family never had any hard luck  because nothing seemed hard luck to it  nor was it ever disgraced for there was nothing which it would acknowledge as disgrace.
author: Boxcar Bertha

quote: Others may argue about whether the world ends with a bang or a whimper. I just want to make sure mine doesn't end with a whine.
author: Barbara Gordon

quote: I never saw a wild thing sorry for itself. A small bird will drop frozen dead from a bough Without ever having felt sorry for itself.
author: D. H. Lawrence

quote: Old age is no place for sissies.
author: Bette Davis

quote: Every message of despair is the statement of a situation from which everybody must freely try to find a way out.
author: Eugene Ionesco

quote: Pain is inevitable  suffering is optional.
author: M. Kathleen Casey

quote: Opposition may become sweet to a man when he has christened it persecution.
author: George Eliot

quote: A man's as miserable as he thinks he is.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: Your distress about life might mean you have been living for the wrong reason  not that you have no reason for living.
author: Tom O'Connor

quote: Children seldom have a proper sense of their own tragedy  discounting and keeping hidden the true horrors of their short lives  humbly imagining real calamity to be some prestigious drama of the grown-up world.
author: Shirley Hazzard

quote: It's not the load that breaks you down  it's the way you carry it.
author: Lena Home

quote: I'm not overweight  I'm just nine inches too short.
author: Shelley Winters

quote: Sadness is almost never anything but a form of fatigue.
author: Andre Gide

quote: The human mind can bear plenty of reality  but not too much unintermit-tent gloom.
author: Margaret Drabble

quote: Misery is a communicable disease.
author: Martha Graham

quote: If you believe  then you hang on. If you believe  it means you've got imagination  you don't need stuff thrown out on a blueprint  and don't face facts - what can stop you? If I don't make it today  I'll come in tomorrow.
author: Ruth Gordon

quote: Never give way to melancholy  resist it steadily  for the habit will encroach.
author: Sydney Smith

quote: Despair is criminal.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Even the cry from the depths is an affirmation: Why cry if there is no hint or hope of hearing?
author: Martin Marty

quote: God hates those who praise themselves.
author: St. Clement

quote: If you wish in this world to advance Your merits you're bound to enhance  You must stir it and stump it  And blow your own trumpet  Or  trust me  you haven't a chance.
author: W. S. Gilbert

quote: Let another man praise thee  and not thine own mouth.
author: Bible

quote: It is better to be tied to any thorny bush than to be with a cross man.
author: Augusta Gregory

quote: I don't follow precedent  I establish it.
author: Fanny Ellen Holtzman

quote: Your future depends on many things  but mostly on you.
author: Frank Tyger

quote: The woman who can create her own job is the one who will win fame and fortune.
author: Amelia Earhart

quote: Don't ask of your friends what you yourself can do.
author: Quintus Ennius

quote: The thing women have got to learn is that nobody gives you power. You just take it.
author: Roseanne Barr

quote: Who ever walked behind anyone to freedom?
author: Hazel Scott

quote: A man who finds no satisfaction in himself  seeks for it in vain elsewhere.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quote: The wise don't expect to find life worth living  they make it that way.
author: Anonymous

quote: I do not wish women to have power over men  but over themselves.
author: Mary Wollstonecraft Shelley

quote: I am learning that if I just go on accepting the framework for life that others have given me  if I fail to make my own choices  the reason for my life will be missing. I will be unable to recognize that which I have the power to change.
author: Liv Ullmann

quote: To be a man is  precisely  to be responsible.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quote: Real adulthood is the result of two qualities: self-discipline and self-reliance. The process of developing them together in balance is called maturing.
author: J. W. Jepson

quote: He who would be well taken care of must take care of himself.
author: William Graham Sumner

quote: What we say and what we do ultimately comes back to us so let us own our responsibility  place it in our hands  and carry it with dignity and strength.
author: Gloria Evangelina Anzaldua

quote: We are free up to the point of choice  then the choice controls the chooser.
author: Mary Crowley

quote: To be born free is an accident  to live free a responsibility  to die free is an obligation.
author: Mrs. Hubbard Davis

quote: The best bet is to bet on yourself.
author: Arnold Glasow

quote: It is not fair to ask of others what you are not willing to do yourself.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: Do for yourself or do without.
author: Gaylord Perry

quote: Intimate relationships cannot substitute for a life plan  but to have any meaning or viability at all  a life plan must include intimate relationships.
author: Harriet Lerner

quote: The great law of denial belongs to the powerful forces of life  whether the case be one of coolish baked beans  or an unrequited affection.
author: Elizabeth Stuart Phelps

quote: For the great benefits of our being- our life  health  and reason-we look upon ourselves.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: I have always regarded myself as the pillar of my life.
author: Meryl Streep

quote: A secure individual... knows that the responsibility for anything concerning his life remains with himself-and he accepts that responsibility.
author: Harry Browne

quote: An axe at home saves hiring a carpenter.
author: J. C. F. von Schiller

quote: We're all in this together ... alone.
author: Lily Tomlin

quote: No one can really pull you up very high-you lose your grip on the rope. But on your own two feet you can climb mountains.
author: Louis Brandeis

quote: We need to find the courage to say no to the things and people that are not serving us if we want to rediscover ourselves and live our lives with authenticity.
author: Barbara De Angelis

quote: No one is in control of your happiness but you  therefore  you have the power to change anything about yourself or your life that you want to change.
author: Barbara De Angelis

quote: Women share with men the need for personal success  even the taste for power  and no longer are we willing to satisfy those needs through the achievements of surrogates  whether husbands  children  or merely role models.
author: Elizabeth Dole

quote: There is no dependence that can be sure but a dependence upon one's self.
author: John Gay

quote: Getting fit is a political act-you are taking charge of your life.
author: Jane Fonda

quote: It is easier to live life through someone else than to become complete yourself.
author: Betty Friedan

quote: Being black does not stop you. You can sit out in the world and say  "Well  white people kept me back  and I can't do this." Not so. You can have anything you want if you make up your mind and you want it.
author: Clara McBride Hale

quote: The future is not in the hands of fate  but in ours.
author: Jules Jusserano

quote: Men are made stronger on realization that the helping hand they need is at the end of their own arm.
author: Sidney J. Phil

quote: I never really address myself to any image anybody has of me. That's like fighting with ghosts.
author: Sally Field

quote: There is no such thing as vicarious experience.
author: Mary Parker Follett

quote: I love being single. It's almost like being rich.
author: Sue Grafton

quote: The best place to find a helping hand is at the end of your own arm.
author: Swedish proverb

quote: Every tub must stand on its own bottom.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: You've got to do your own growing  no matter how tall your grandfather was.
author: Irish proverb

quote: Do not rely completely on any other human being  however dear. We meet all of life's greatest tests alone.
author: Agnes Macphail

quote: Only those means of security are good  are certain  are lasting  that depend on yourself and your own vigor.
author: Niccolo Machiavelli

quote: I don't want to be a passenger in my own life.
author: Diane Ackerman

quote: Independence is happiness.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: Woman must not depend upon the protection of man  but must be taught to protect herself.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: Every man paddles his own canoe.
author: Frederick Marryat

quote: If you would have a faithful servant  and one that you like  serve yourself.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: If you want a thing done  go  if not  send.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: I am not afraid of storms  for I am learning how to sail my ship.
author: Louisa May Alcott

quote: Our remedies oft in ourselves do lie.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: If it is to be  it is up to me.
author: Anonymous

quote: There are three types of baseball players-those who make it happen  those who watch it happen  and those who wonder what happened.
author: Tommy Lasorda

quote: Rogers sees daylight. Campbell makes daylight.
author: Bum Phillips

quote: I leave before being left. I decide.
author: Brigitte Bardot

quote: No man may make another free.
author: Zora Neale Hurston

quote: The best things in life must come by effort from within  not by gifts from the outside.
author: Fred Corson

quote: Living by proxy is always a precarious expedient.
author: Simone de Beauvoir

quote: When I saw something that needed doing  I did it.
author: Nellie Cashman

quote: The only discipline that lasts is self-discipline.
author: Bum Phillips

quote: The destiny of man is in his own soul.
author: Herodotus

quote: My future is one I must make myself.
author: Louis L'Amour

quote: Faced with crisis  the man of character falls back on himself.
author: Charles de Gaulle

quote: If there is no wind  row.
author: Latin proverb

quote: No bird soars too high if he soars on his own wings.
author: William Blake

quote: Seek not good from without: seek it within yourselves  or you will never find it.
author: Bertha von Suttner

quote: We carry with us the wonders we seek without us.
author: Sir Thomas Browne

quote: As far as beauty is concerned  in order to be confident we must accept that the way we look and feel is our own responsibility.
author: Sophia Loren

quote: Ruin and recovery are both from within.
author: Epictetus

quote: Learn to get in touch with silence within yourself and know that everything in life has a purpose.
author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross

quote: People are like stained-glass windows. They sparkle and shine when the sun is out  but when the darkness sets in  their true beauty is revealed only if there is a light from within.
author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross

quote: If you can't change your fate  change your attitude.
author: Amy Tan

quote: He who is plenteously provided for from within needs but little from without.
author: Johann von Goethe

quote: What pulls the strings is the force hidden within  there lies ... the real man.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: The foundations which we would dig about and find are within us  like the Kingdom of Heaven  rather than without.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: No external advantages can supply self-reliance. The force of one's being ... must come from within.
author: R. W. Clark

quote: Every time I start a picture ... I feel the same fear  the same self-doubts ... and I have only one source on which I can draw  because it comes from within me.
author: Federico Fellini

quote: There is no man so low down that the cure for his condition does not lie strictly within himself.
author: Thomas L. Masson

quote: It is what you are inside that matters. You  yourself  are your only real capital.
author: Vladimir Zworykin

quote: Look well into thyself  there is a source which will always spring up if thou wilt always search there.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: I've never met a person  I don't care what his condition  in whom I could not see possibilities. I don't care how much a man may consider himself a failure  I believe in him  for he can change the thing that is wrong in his life anytime he is prepared and ready to do it. Whenever he develops the desire  he can take away from his life the thing that is defeating it. The capacity for reformation and change lies within.
author: Preston Bradley

quote: You will not find poetry anywhere unless you bring some of it with you.
author: Joseph Joubert

quote: God  why do I storm heaven for answers that are already in my heart? Every grace I need has already been given me. Oh  lead me to the Beyond within.
author: Macrina Wiederkehr

quote: The only Zen you find on the tops of mountains is the Zen you bring up there.
author: Robert M. Pirsig

quote: There ain't nothing from the outside can lick any of us.
author: Margaret Mitchell

quote: Man must be arched and buttressed from within  else the temple wavers to dust.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: There is no reality except the one contained within us.
author: Hermann Hesse

quote: Religious faith  indeed  relates to that which is above us  but it must arise from that which is within us.
author: Josiah Royce

quote: God creates the animals  man creates himself.
author: Georg Christoph Lichtenberg

quote: Let women be provided with living strength of their own.
author: Simone de Beauvoir

quote: Man cannot remake himself without suffering  for he is both the marble and the sculptor.
author: Dr. Alexis Carrel

quote: Every man is his own ancestor  and every man his own heir. He devises his own future  and he inherits his own past.
author: H. F. Hedge

quote: In the long run we shape our lives and we shape ourselves. The process never ends until we die. And the choices we make are ultimately our own responsibility.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: Our awesome responsibility to ourselves  to our children  and to the future is to create ourselves in the image of goodness  because the future depends on the nobility of our imaginings.
author: Barbara Grizzuti Harrison

quote: Up to a point a man's life is shaped by environment  heredity  and movements and changes in the world about him  then there comes a time when it lies within his grasp to shape the clay of his life into the sort of thing he wishes to be. ... Everyone has it within his power to say  this I am today  that I shall be tomorrow.
author: Louis L'Amour

quote: We either make ourselves miserable  or we make ourselves strong. The amount of work is the same.
author: Carlos Castaneda

quote: I  woman  give birth: and this time to myself.
author: Alma Villanueva

quote: Exude happiness and you will feel it back a thousand times.
author: Joan Lunden

quote: What you have become is the price you paid to get what you used to want.
author: Mignon McLaughlin

quote: You are the product of your own brainstorm.
author: Rosemary Konner Steinbaum

quote: I long to put the experience of fifty years at once into your young lives  to give you at once the key to that treasure chamber every gem of which has cost me tears and struggles and prayers  but you must work for these inward treasures yourselves.
author: Harriet Beecher Stowe

quote: There's only one corner of the universe you can be certain of improving  and that's your own self.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Parents can only give good advice or put them on the right paths  but the final forming of a person's character lies in their own hands.
author: Anne Frank

quote: You need to claim the events in your life to make yourself yours. When you truly possess all you have been and done  which may take some time  you are fierce with reality.
author: Florida Scott-Maxwell

quote: I would not sit waiting for some value tomorrow  nor for something to happen. One could wait a lifetime. ... I would make something happen.
author: Louis L'Amour

quote: I truly believe that women of my generation can bring a new cleansing element to American public life.
author: Georgie Anne Geyer

quote: Circumstances are the rulers of the weak  they are but the instruments of the wise.
author: Samuel Lover

quote: Sometimes you gotta create what you want to be a part of.
author: Geri Weitzman

quote: Circumstances-what are circumstances? I make circumstances.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: Man is not the creature of circumstances  circumstances are the creature of man. We are free agents  and man is more powerful than matter.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: It is our relation to circumstances that determines their influence over us. The same wind that carries one vessel into port may blow another off shore.
author: Christian Bovee

quote: We will either find a way  or make one.
author: Hannibal

quote: People are always blaming their circumstances for what they are. The people who get on in this world are they who get up and look for the circumstances they want  and  if they can't find them  make them.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Choice of attention-to pay attention to this and ignore that-is to the inner life what choice of action is to the outer. In both cases  a man is responsible for his choice and must accept the consequences.
author: W. H. Auden

quote: Heaven and hell is right now. ... You make it heaven or you make it hell by your actions.
author: George Harrison

quote: Freedom means choosing your burden.
author: Hephzibah Menuhin

quote: We create our fate every day ... most of the ills we suffer from are directly traceable to our own behavior.
author: Henry Miller

quote: You have to take it as it happens  but you should try to make it happen the way you want to take it.
author: Old German proverb

quote: The winds and waves are always on the side of the ablest navigators.
author: Edward Gibbon

quote: A life of reaction is a life of slavery  intellectually and spiritually. One must fight for a life of action  not reaction.
author: Rita Mae Brown

quote: Life is raw material. We are artisans. We can sculpt our existence into something beautiful  or debase it into ugliness. It's in our hands.
author: Cathy Better

quote: The proverb warns that "You should not bite that hand that feeds you." But maybe you should  if it prevents you from feeding yourself.
author: Thomas Szasz

quote: If we live good lives  the times are also good. As we are  such are the times.
author: Saint Augustine

quote: Change and growth take place when a person has risked himself and dares to become involved with experimenting with his own life.
author: Herbert Otto

quote: They have rights who dare defend them.
author: Roger Baldwin

quote: Make good use of bad rubbish.
author: Elizabeth Beresford

quote: Things alter for the worse spontaneously  if they be not altered for the better designedly.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: Things don't turn up in this world until somebody turns them up.
author: James A. Garfield

quote: Is life so wretched? Isn't it rather your hands which are too small  your vision which is muddied? You are the one who must grow up.
author: Dag Hammarskjold

quote: Some leaders are born women.
author: Geraldine Ferraro

quote: Be thine own palace  or the world's thy jail.
author: John Donne

quote: A filly who wants to run will always find a rider.
