author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Strong and bitter words indicate a weak cause.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Love is strong as death  jealousy is cruel as the grave.
author: Bible

quote: Histories make men wise  poets  witty  the mathematics  subtile  natural philosophy  deep  morals  grave  logic and rhetoric  able to contend.
author: Sir Francis Bacon

quote: There are more men ennobled by study than by nature.
author: Cicero

quote: The world's great men have not commonly been great scholars  nor its great scholars great men.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: As turning the logs will make a dull fire burn  so change of studies a dull brain.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: You are in some brown study.
author: John Lyly

quote: Iron sharpens iron  scholar  the scholar.
author: Talmud

quote: We are growing serious  and  let me tell you  that's a very next step to being dull.
author: Joseph Addison

quote: The bookful blockhead  ignorantly read  With loads of learned lumber in his head.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Against stupidity the very gods Themselves contend in vain.
author: Friedrich von Schiller

quote: One who uses many periods is a philosopher  many interrogations  a student  many exclamations  a fanatic.
author: J. L. Basford

quote: Style is the dress of thoughts.
author: Lord Chesterfield

quote: Montesquieu had the style of a genius  Buffon  the genius of style.
author: Baron Grimm

quote: Neat  not gaudy.
author: Charles Lamb

quote: Lxnig sentences in a short composition are like large rooms in a little house.
author: William Shenstone

quote: You gain strength  courage and confidence by every experience in which you really stop to look fear in the face.... You must do the thing you think you cannot do.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: If you banish fear  nothing terribly bad can happen to you.
author: Margaret Bourke-White

quote: I believe that anyone can conquer fear by doing the things he fears to do  provided he keeps doing them until he gets a record of successful experiences behind him.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: When in fear  it is safest to force the attack.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: The way to develop self-confidence is to do the thing you fear  and get a record of successful experiences behind you.
author: William Jennings Bryan

quote: He that fleeth from the fear shall fall into the pit.
author: Bible

quote: To live with fear and not be afraid is the final test of maturity.
author: Edward Weeks

quote: Constant exposure to dangers will breed contempt for them.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: To do anything in this world worth doing  we must not stand back shivering and thinking of the cold and danger  but jump in and scramble through as well as we can.
author: Sydney Smith

quote: Do the thing you fear  and the death of fear is certain.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: I wanted to be scared again ... I wanted to feel unsure again. That's the only way I learn  the only way I feel challenged.
author: Connie Chung

quote: You cannot run away from a weakness. You must sometimes fight it out or perish  and if that be so  why not now  and where you stand?
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: Often I have found that the one thing that can save is the thing which appears most to threaten ... one has to go down into what one most fears and in that process ... comes a saving flicker of light and energy that  even if it does not produce the courage of a hero  at any rate enables a trembling mortal to take one step further.
author: Laurens Van der Post

quote: I was afraid to write Fear of Flying  ergo  I had to write it. I have lived my life according to this principle: If I'm afraid of it  then I must do it.
author: Erica Jong

quote: One ought never to turn one's back on a threatened danger and try to run away from it. If you do that  you will double the danger. But if you meet it promptly and without flinching  you will reduce the danger by half. Never run away from anything. Never!
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Being "brave" means doing or facing something frightening. ... Being "fearless" means being without fear.
author: Penelope Leach

quote: From a distance it is something  and nearby it is nothing.
author: Jean de la Fontaine

quote: What you are afraid to do is a clear indicator of the next thing you need to do.
author: Anonymous

quote: He that is afraid to shake the dice will never throw a six.
author: Chinese proverb

quote: The most drastic  and usually the most effective  remedy for fear is direct action.
author: William Burnham

quote: To be busy with material affairs is the best preservative against reflection  fears  doubts.... I suppose a fellow proposing to cut his throat would experience a sort of relief while occupied in stropping his razor carefully.
author: Joseph Conrad

quote: I think we should follow a simple rule: if we can take the worst  take the risk.
author: Dr. Joyce Brothers

quote: Happiness is to take up the struggle in the midst of the raging storm  not to pluck the lute in the moonlight or recite poetry among the blossoms.
author: Ding Ling

quote: Winners take chances. Like everyone else  they fear failing  but they refuse to let fear control them.
author: Nancy Simms

quote: Many of our fears are tissuepaper-thin  and a single courageous step would carry us clear through them.
author: Brendan Francis

quote: The habit of doing one's duty drives away fear.
author: Charles Baudelaire

quote: Become so wrapped up in something that you forget to be afraid.
author: Lady Bird Johnson

quote: Things done well and with care exempt themselves from fear.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Ultimately we know deeply that the other side of every fear is freedom.
author: Marilyn Ferguson

quote: One had to take some action against fear when once it laid hold of one.
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

quote: Too busy with the crowded hour to fear to live or die.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: A life of action and danger moderates the dread of death. It not only gives us fortitude to bear pain  but teaches us at every step the precarious tenure on which we hold our present being.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: If you want to conquer fear  don't sit at home and think about it. Go out and get busy.
author: Dale Carnegie

quote: Half our fears are baseless  the other half discreditable.
author: Christian Bovee

quote: We poison our lives with fear of burglary and shipwreck and ... the house is never burgled  and the ship never goes down.
author: Jean Anouilh

quote: To relinquish a present good through apprehension of a future evil is in most instances unwise ... from a fear which may afterwards turn out groundless  you lost the good that lay within your grasp.
author: Francesco Guicciardini

quote: Envy and fear are the only passions to which no pleasure is attached.
author: John Churton Collins

quote: There is often less danger in the things we fear than in the things we desire.
author: John Churton Collins

quote: Needless fear and panic over disease or misfortune that seldom materialize are simply bad habits. By proper ventilation and illumination of the mind it is possible to cultivate tolerance  poise and real courage.
author: Elie Metchnikoff

quote: There are very few monsters who warrant the fear we have of them.
author: Andre Gide

quote: When thinking won't cure fear  action will.
author: W Clement Stone

quote: Above all things  never be afraid. The enemy who forces you to retreat is himself afraid of you at that very moment.
author: Andre Maurois

quote: Every great batter works on the theory that the pitcher is more afraid of him than he is of the pitcher.
author: Ty Cobb

quote: The superpowers often behave like two heavily armed blind men feeling their way around a room  each believing himself in mortal peril from the other  whom he assumes to have perfect vision.
author: Henry Kissinger

quote: General Grant had a simple  childlike recipe for meeting life ... "I am terribly afraid  but the other fellow is afraid  too."
author: Sherwood Anderson

quote: If you knew how cowardly your enemy is  you would slap him. Bravery is knowledge of the cowardice in the enemy.
author: Edgar Watson Howe

quote: Mountains appear more lofty the nearer they are approached  but great men resemble them not in this particular.
author: Lady Marguerite Blessington

quote: I have found adventure in flying  in world travel  in business  and even close at hand. ... Adventure is a state of mind-and spirit. It comes with faith  for with complete faith there is no fear of what faces you in life or death.
author: Jacqueline Cochran

quote: There is much in the world to make us afraid. There is much more in our faith to make us unafraid.
author: Frederick W Cropp

quote: Deep faith eliminates fear.
author: Lech Walesa

quote: Fear knocked at the door. Faith answered. And lo  no one was there.
author: Anonymous

quote: A perfect faith would lift us absolutely above fear.
author: George Macdonald

quote: If fear is cultivated it will become stronger. If faith is cultivated it will achieve the mastery ... faith is the stronger emotion because it is positive  whereas fear is negative.
author: John Paul Jones

quote: Fear imprisons  faith liberates  fear paralyzes  faith empowers  fear disheartens  faith encourages  fear sickens  faith heals  fear makes useless  faith makes serviceable.
author: Harry Emerson Fosdick

quote: Fear is faith that it won't work out.
author: Sister Mary Tricky

quote: Fear is the absence of faith.
author: Paul Tillich

quote: Faith in yourself and faith in God are the key to mastery of fear.
author: Harold Sherman

quote: God is our refuge and strength  a very present help in trouble. Therefore we will not fear.
author: Bible

quote: I will not fear  for you are ever with me  and you will never leave me to face my perils alone.
author: Thomas Merton

quote: Fear is faithlessness.
author: George Macdonald

quote: I stopped believing in Santa Claus when I was six. Mother took me to see him in a department store and he asked for my autograph.
author: Shirley Temple

quote: Nothing recedes like success.
author: Walter Winchell

quote: Perseverance  n.: A lowly virtue whereby mediocrity achieves a glorious success.
author: Ambrose Bierce

quote: Success for the striver washes away the effort of striving.
author: Pindar

quote: The penalty of success is to be bored by people who used to snub you.
author: Nancy, Lady Astor

quote: The secret of success is constancy to purpose.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: There are few successful adults who were not first successful children.
author: Alexander Chase

quote: What is success? To laugh often and much  To win the respect of intelligent people and the affection of children  To earn the appreciation of honest critics and endure the betrayal of false friends  To appreciate beauty  To find the best in others  To leave the world a bit better  whether by a healthy child  a garden patch or a redeemed social condition  To know even one life has breathed easier because you have lived  That is to have succeeded.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: If one advances confidently in the direction of his dreams  and endeavours to live the life which he has imagined  he will meet with a success unexpected in common hours.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: The world belongs to the enthusiast who keeps cool.
author: William McFee

quote: Out of every fruition of success  no matter what  comes forth something to make a new effort necessary.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: Though a tree grow ever so high  the falling leaves return to the root.
author: Malay proverb

quote: Success is that old ABC- ability  breaks and courage.
author: Charles Luckman

quote: How can they say my life isn't a success? Have I not for more than sixty years got enough to eat and escaped being eaten?
author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quote: You always pass failure on the way to success.
author: Mickey Rooney

quote: Of course there is no formula for success except perhaps  an unconditional acceptance of life and what it brings.
author: Artur Rubinstein

quote: High station in life is earned by the gallantry with which appalling experiences are survived with grace.
author: Tennessee Williams

quote: Everything bows to success  even grammar.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Never having been able to succeed in the world  he took his revenge by speaking ill of it.
author: Voltaire

quote: The successful people are the ones who think up things for the rest of the world to keep busy at.
author: Don Marquis

quote: It is no use saying 'we are doing our best.' You have got to succeed in doing what is necessary.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Survival is triumph enough.
author: Harry Crews

quote: It takes time to be a success  but time is all it takes.
author: Anonymous

quote: There is a passion for perfection which you will rarely see fully developed  but you may note this fact  that in successful lives it is never wholly lacking.
author: Bliss Carman

quote: Nothing fails like success  nothing is so defeated as yesterday's triumphant cause.
author: Phyllis McGinley

quote: The toughest thing about success is that you've got to keep on being a success.
author: Irving Berlin

quote: Nothing fails like success because we don't learn from it. We learn only from failure.
author: Kenneth Boulding

quote: Get place and wealth  if possible with grace  If not  by any means get wealth and place.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Success is not so much what you are  but rather what you appear to be.
author: Anonymous

quote: I cannot give you the formula for success  but I can give you the formula for failure  which is - try to please everybody.
author: Herbert Bayard Swope

quote: Success has made failures of many men.
author: Cindy Adams

quote: A successful man is he who receives a great deal from his fellow men  usually incomparably more than corresponds to his service to them. The value of a man  however  should be seen in what he gives and not in what he is able to receive.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Success is not the result of spontaneous combustion. You must set yourself on fire.
author: Reggie Leach

quote: Success is the progressive realization of a worthy ideal.
author: Earl Nightingale

quote: A great secret of success is to go through life as a man who never gets used up.
author: Albert Schweitzer

quote: Failure changes for the better  success for the worse.
author: Seneca

quote: Behind every successful man there's a lot of unsuccessful years.
author: Bob Brown

quote: If people knew what they had to do to be successful  most people wouldn't.
author: Lord Thomson of Fleet

quote: The secret of all victory lies in the organization of the non-obvious.
author: Oswald Spengler

quote: Snowflakes are one of nature's most fragile things  but just look what they can do when they stick together.
author: Vesta M. Kelly

quote: Damon Runyon. A day-coach boy in a parlor car seat.
author: Damon Runyon

quote: There is only one success - to be able to spend your life in your own way.
author: Christopher Morley

quote: Find a need and fill it.
author: Ruth Stafford Peale

quote: The successful person is the individual who forms the habit of doing what the failing person doesn't like to do.
author: Donald Riggs

quote: The victory of success is half done when one gains the habit of work.
author: Sarah Knowles Bolton

quote: The secret of every man who has ever been successful lies in the fact that he formed the bait of doing those things that failures don't like to do.
author: A. Jackson King

quote: Nature gave men two ends-one to sit on  and one to think with. Ever since then man's success or failure has been dependent on the one he used most.
author: George R. Kirkpatrick

quote: Make yourself indispensable and you'll be moved up. Act as if you're indispensable and you'll be moved out.
author: Anonymous

quote: What is the recipe for successful achievement? To my mind there are just four essential ingredients: Choose a career you love. ... Give it the best there is in you.... Seize your opportunities. ... And be a member of the team.
author: Benjamin F. Fairless

quote: Vacillating people seldom succeed. They seldom win the solid respect of their fellows. Successful men and women are very careful in reaching decisions  and very persistent and determined in action thereafter.
author: L. G. Elliott

quote: Many people have the ambition to succeed  they may even have a special aptitude for their job. And yet they do not move ahead. Why? Perhaps they think that since they can master the job  there is no need to master themselves.
author: John Stevenson

quote: I've been polite and I've always shown up. Somebody asked me if I had any advice for young people entering the business. I said: "Yeah  show up."
author: Tom T. Hall

quote: The wise man puts all his eggs in one basket and watches the basket.
author: Andrew Carnegie

quote: I know the price of success: dedication  hard work and an unremitting devotion to the things you want to see happen.
author: Frank Lloyd Wright

quote: Success is that old ABC-Ability  Breaks and Courage.
author: Charles Luckman

quote: The secret of success in life is for a man to be ready for his opportunity when it comes.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: If one advances confidently in the direction of his dreams  and endeavors to live the life which he has imaged  he will meet with success unexpected in common hours.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Before everything else  getting ready is the secret of success.
author: Henry Ford

quote: To be ambitious for wealth  and yet always expecting to be poor  to be always doubting your ability to get what you long for  is like trying to reach east by traveling west. There is no philosophy which will help man to succeed when he is always doubting his ability to do so  and thus attracting failure. No matter how hard you work for success  if your thought is saturated with the fear of failure  it will kill your efforts  neutralize your endeavors and make success impossible.
author: Charles Baudouin

quote: I cannot give you the formula for success  but I can give you the formula for failure  which is-try to please everybody.
author: Herbert Bayard Swope

quote: We may fail of our happiness  strive we ever so bravely  but we are less likely to fail if we measure with judgement our chances and our capabilities.
author: Agnes Repplier

quote: A double-minded man is unstable in all his ways.... A determinate purpose in life and a steady adhesion to it through all disadvantages are indispensable conditions of success.
author: William M. Punshion

quote: The conditions of conquest are always easy. We have but to toil awhile  endure awhile  believe always  and never turn back.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: The very first step towards success in any occupation is to become interested in it.
author: Sir William Osier

quote: I studied the lives of great men and famous women  and I found that the men and women who got to the top were those who did the jobs they had in hand  with everything they had of energy and enthusiasm and hard work.
author: Harry S. Truman

quote: Without ambition one starts nothing. Without work one finishes nothing. The prize will not be sent to you. As to methods there may be a million and then some  but the principles are few. The man who grasps principles can successfully select his own methods. The man who tries methods  ignoring principles  is sure to have trouble.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: There are no secrets to success. It is the result of preparation  hard work  learning from failure.
author: General Colin L. Powell

quote: Success is blocked by concentrating on it and planning for it.... Success is shy-it won't come out while you're watching.
author: Tennessee Williams

quote: Three outstanding qualities make for success: judgement  industry  health. And the greatest of these is judgement.
author: William Maxwell Aitken

quote: Thirteen virtues necessary for true success: temperance  silence  order  resolution  frugality  industry  sincerity  justice  moderation  cleanliness  tranquility  chastity  and humility.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Find a need and fill it.
author: Ruth Stafford Peale

quote: Put your heart  mind  intellect and soul even to your smallest acts. This is the secret of success.
author: Swami Sivananda

quote: Four steps to achievement: plan purposefully  prepare prayerfully  proceed positively  pursue persistently.
author: William A. Ward

quote: Success follows doing what you want to do. There is no other way to be successful.
author: Malcolm Forbes

quote: Always aim for achievement  and forget about success.
author: Helen Hayes

quote: Success  which is something so simple in the end  is made up of thousands of things  we never fully know what.
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

quote: Self-trust is the first secret of success.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: The man who will use his skill and constructive imagination to see how much he can give for a dollar  instead of how little he can give for a dollar  is bound to succeed.
author: Henry Ford

quote: So once I shut down my privilege of disliking anyone I choose and holding myself aloof if I could manage it  greater understanding  growing compassion came to me.
author: Catharine Marshall

quote: The most important single ingredient in the formula of success is knowing how to get along with people.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: Remember  the bread you meet each day is still rising. Don't scare the dough.
author: Macrina Wiederkehr

quote: The art of dealing with people is the foremost secret of successful men. A man's success in handling people is the very yardstick by which the outcome of his whole life's work is measured.
author: Paul C. Packe

quote: The ability to form friendships  to make people believe in you and trust you is one of the few absolutely fundamental qualities of success. Selling  buying  negotiating are so much smoother and easier when the parties enjoy each other's confidence. The young man who can make friends quickly will find that he will glide  instead of stumble  through life.
author: John J. McGuirk

quote: Networking is an enrichment program  not an entitlement program.
author: Susan RoAne

quote: Respect for people is the cornerstone of communication and networking.
author: Susan RoAne

quote: No matter how much a man can do  no matter how engaging his personality may be  he will not advance far in business if he cannot work through others.
author: John Craig

quote: The way to rise is to obey and please.
author: Ben Johnson

quote: Skill is fine  and genius is splendid  but the right contacts are more valuable than either.
author: Sir Archibald Mclndoe

quote: Whatever your grade or position  if you know how and when to speak  and when to remain silent  your chances of real success are proportionately increased.
author: Ralph C. Smedley

quote: That they can strengthen through the empowerment of others is essential wisdom often gathered by women.
author: Mary Field Belenky

quote: A man can succeed at almost anything for which he has unlimited enthusiasm.
author: Charles M. Schwab

quote: You have to block everything out and be extremely focused and be relaxed and mellow too.
author: Jennifer Capriati

quote: I've never sought success in order to get fame and money  it's the talent and the passion that count in success.
author: Ingrid Bergman

quote: Flaming enthusiasm  backed up by horse sense and persistence  is the quality that most frequently makes for success.
author: Dale Carnegie

quote: Anyone who has gumption knows what it is  and anyone who hasn't can never know what it is.
author: L. M. Montgomery

quote: The world belongs to the energetic.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: I feel that one must deliberate then act  must scan every life choice with rational thinking but then base the decision on whether one's heart will be in it.
author: Jean Shinoda Bolen

quote: Since everything is in our heads  we better not lose them.
author: Coco Chanel

quote: There is a passion for perfection which you rarely see fully developed  but you may note this fact  that in successful lives it is never wholly lacking.
author: Bliss Carman

quote: Many of the most successful men I have known have never grown up. They have retained bubbling-over boyishness. They have relished wit  they have indulged in humor. They have not allowed "dignity" to depress them into moroseness. Youthfulness of spirit is the twin brother of optimism  and optimism is the stuff of which American business success is fashioned. Resist growing up!
author: B. C. Forbes

quote: People are subject to moods  to temptations and fears  lethargy and aberration and ignorance  and the staunchest qualities shift under the stresses and strains of daily life.
author: Ilka Chase

quote: Whoever said  "It's not whether you win or lose that counts " probably lost.
author: Martina Navratilova

quote: If you have the will to win  you have achieved half your success  if you don't  you have achieved half your failure.
author: David V. A. Ambrose

quote: Someone's always saying  "It's not whether you win or lose " but if you feel that way  you're as good as dead.
author: James Caan

quote: The real difference between men is energy.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: Success is going from failure to failure without loss of enthusiasm.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: To bring one's self to a frame of mind and to the proper energy to accomplish things that require plain hard work continuously is the one big battle that everyone has. When this battle is won for all time  then everything is easy.
author: Thomas A. Buckner

quote: We would accomplish many more things if we did not think of them as impossible.
author: C. Malesherbez

quote: Faith that the thing can be done is essential to any great achievement.
author: Thomas N. Carruther

quote: Sometimes success is due less to ability than to zeal.
author: Charles Buxton

quote: We can accomplish almost anything within our ability if we but think that we can!
author: George Matthew Adams

quote: Optimism is essential to achievement and it is also the foundation of courage and of true progress.
author: Nicholas Murray Butler

quote: Morale is the greatest single factor in successful wars.
author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quote: The will to conquer is the first condition of victory.
author: Marshal Ferdinand Foch

quote: Always bear in mind that your own resolution to success is more important than any other one thing.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: The real secret of success is enthusiasm. Yes  more than enthusiasm  I would say excitement. I like to see men get excited. When they get excited  they make a success of their lives.
author: Walter Chrysler

quote: It is fatal to enter any war without the will to win it.
author: General Douglas MacArthur

quote: The measure of an enthusiasm must be taken between interesting events. It is between bites that the lukewarm angler loses heart.
author: Edwin Way Teale

quote: Enthusiasm for one's goal lessens the disagreeableness of working toward it.
author: Thomas Eakins

quote: To burn always with this hard gemlike flame  to maintain this ecstasy  is success in life.
author: Walter Pater

quote: Every man is enthusiastic at times. One man has enthusiasm for thirty minutes  another man has it for thirty days. But it is the man who has it for thirty years who makes a success in life.
author: Edward B. Butler

quote: Man never rises to great truths without enthusiasm.
author: Vauvenargues

quote: Success is due less to ability than to zeal.
author: Charles Buxton

quote: I rate enthusiasm even above professional skill.
author: Sir Edward Appleton

quote: Do it big or stay in bed.
author: Larry Kelly

quote: Nothing great was ever achieved without enthusiasm.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: What a man accomplishes in a day depends upon the way in which he approaches his tasks. When we accept tough jobs as a challenge to our ability and wade into them with joy and enthusiasm  miracles can happen. When we do our work with a dynamic conquering spirit  we get things done.
author: Arland Gilbert

quote: If you're not happy every morning when you get up  leave for work  or start to work at home  if you're not enthusiastic about doing that  you're not going to be successful.
author: Donald M. Kendall

quote: The method of the enterprising is to plan with audacity and execute with vigor.
author: Christian Bovee

quote: A strong passion for any object will ensure success  for the desire of the end will point out the means.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: If you want to succeed  you must make your own opportunities as you go.
author: John B. Gough

quote: A wise man will make more opportunities than he finds.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: No man will succeed unless he is ready to face and overcome difficulties and prepared to assume responsibilities.
author: William J. H. Boetcker

quote: Man is still responsible. ... His success lies not with the stars  but with himself. He must carry on the fight of self-correction and discipline.
author: Frank Curtis Williams

quote: No one can help you in holding a good job except Old Man You.
author: Edgar Watson Howe

quote: Under normal periods  any man's success hinges about five percent on what others do for him and 95 percent on what he does.
author: James A. Worsham

quote: If  after all  men cannot always make history have a meaning  they can always act so that their own lives have one.
author: Albert Camus

quote: The brave man carves out his fortune  and every man is the sum of his own works.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: If a man wants his dreams to come true  he must wake up.
author: Anonymous

quote: Pa  he always said a man had to look spry for himself  because nobody would do it for him  your opportunities didn't come knocking around  you had to hunt them down and hog-tie them.
author: Louis L'Amour

quote: Men at some time are masters of their fates.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Destiny is not a matter of chance  it is a matter of choice  it is not a thing to be waited for  it is a thing to be achieved.
author: William Jennings Bryan

quote: The people who get on in this world are the people who get up and look for the circumstances they want  and  if they can't find them  make them.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Every man is the architect of his own fortune.
author: Sallust

quote: The men who have done big things are those who were not afraid to attempt big things  who were not afraid to risk failure in order to gain success.
author: B. C. Forbes

quote: If the risk-reward ratio is right  you can make big money buying trouble.
author: Anonymous

quote: What isn't tried won't work.
author: Claude McDonald

quote: He that is overcautious will accomplish little.
author: J. C. F. von Schiller

quote: All great reforms require one to dare a lot to win a little.
author: William L. O'Neill

quote: If you limit your actions in life to things that nobody can possibly find fault with  you will not do much.
author: Charles Lutwidge Dodgson

quote: The ambitious climbs high and perilous stairs and never cares how to come down  the desire of rising hath swallowed up his fear of a fall.
author: Thomas Adams

quote: He that would have fruit must climb the tree.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: To get profit without risk  experience without danger and reward without work is as impossible as it is to live without being born.
author: A. P. Gouthey

quote: Every noble acquisition is attended with its risks  he who fears to encounter the one must not expect to obtain the other.
author: Pietro Metastasio

quote: The method of the enterprising is to plan with audacity and execute with vigor.
author: Christian Bovee

quote: Great deeds are usually wrought at great risks.
author: Herodotus

quote: Only those who dare to fail greatly can ever achieve greatly.
author: Robert F. Kennedy

quote: No one reaches a high position without daring.
author: Publilius Syrus

quote: Cadillacs are down at the end of the bat.
author: Ralph Kiner

quote: It is impossible to win the great prizes of life without running risks.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: You can't expect to hit the jackpot if you don't put a few nickels in the machine.
author: Flip Wilson

quote: Who dares nothing  need hope for nothing.
author: J. C. F. von Schiller

quote: Progress always involves risks. You can't steal second base and keep your foot on first.
author: Frederick B. Wilcox

quote: I don't think about risks much. I just do what I want to do. If you gotta go  you gotta go.
author: Lillian Carter

quote: Behold the turtle. He makes progress only when he sticks his neck out.
author: James Bryant Conant

quote: Nothing ventured  nothing gained.
author: Anonymous

quote: You can't catch trout with dry breeches.
author: Spanish proverb

quote: Don't be afraid to take a big step if one is indicated. You can't cross a chasm in two small jumps.
author: David Lloyd George

quote: Because a fellow has failed once or twice or a dozen times  you don't want to set him down as a failure till he's dead or loses his courage-and that's the same thing.
author: George Horace Lorimer

quote: What is more mortifying than to feel that you have missed the plum for want of courage to shake the tree?
author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quote: To persevere  trusting in what hopes he has  is courage. The coward despairs.
author: Euripides

quote: Whatever you do  you need courage. ... To map out a course of action and follow it to an end requires some of the same courage which a soldier needs.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Who dares nothing  need hope for nothing.
author: J. C. F. von Schiller

quote: Have the courage of your desire.
author: George R. Gissing

quote: To see what is right  and not do it  is want of courage.
author: Confucius

quote: It takes vision and courage to create- it takes faith and courage to prove.
author: Owen D. Young

quote: No great thing comes to any man unless he has courage.
author: Cardinal James Gibbons

quote: Great things are done more through courage than through wisdom.
author: German proverb

quote: Courage permits the caliber of performance to continue at its peak  until the finish line is crossed.
author: Stuart Walker

quote: Failure is only postponed success as long as courage "coaches" ambition. The habit of persistence is the habit of victory.
author: Herbert Kaufman

quote: Courage and perseverance have a magical talisman  before which difficulties disappear  and obstacles vanish into air.
author: John Quincy Adams

quote: You will never do anything in this world without courage.
author: James Lane Allen

quote: It takes as much courage to have tried and failed as it does to have tried and succeeded.
author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

quote: Where there is a brave man  in the thickest of the fight  there is the post of honor.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Whenever you see a successful business  someone once made a courageous decision.
author: Peter Drucker

quote: There are a lot of fellas with all the ability it takes to play in the major leagues  but they never make it  they always get stuck in the minor leagues because they haven't got the guts to make the climb.
author: Cookie Lavagetto

quote: Courage to start and willingness to keep everlasting at it are the requisites for success.
author: Alonzo Newton Benn

quote: One of the biggest factors in success is the courage to undertake something.
author: James A. Worsham

quote: It is weak and despicable to go on wanting things and not trying to get them.
author: Joanna Field

quote: The measure of achievement is not winning awards. It's doing something that you appreciate  something you believe is worthwhile. I think of my strawberry souffle. I did that at least twenty-eight times before I finally conquered it.
author: Julia Child

quote: Nothing worthwhile comes easily. Half effort does not produce half results. It produces no results. Work  continuous work and hard work  is the only way to accomplish results that last.
author: Hamilton Holt

quote: If a man wakes up famous he hasn't been sleeping.
author: Wes Izzard

quote: What it comes down to is that anybody can win with the best horse. What makes you good is if you can take the second or third best horse and win.
author: Vicky Aragon

quote: Success is dependent on effort.
author: Sophocles

quote: Success comes before work only in the dictionary.
author: Anonymous

quote: Success is having a flair for the thing that you are doing  knowing that is not enough  that you have got to have hard work and a sense of purpose.
author: Margaret Thatcher

quote: Striving for success without hard work is like trying to harvest where you haven't planted.
author: David Bly

quote: Sweat plus sacrifice equals success.
author: Charles O. Finley

quote: Success usually comes to those who are too busy to be looking for it.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Excellence in any pursuit is the late  ripe fruit of toil.
author: W. M. L. Jay

quote: It's in the preparation-in those dreary pedestrian virtues they taught you in seventh grade and you didn't believe. It's making the extra call and caring a lot.
author: Diane Sawyer

quote: In all human affairs there are efforts  and there are results  and the strength of the effort is the measure of the result.
author: James Lane Allen

quote: It is no use saying "we are doing our best." You have got to succeed in doing what is necessary.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Social advance depends as much upon the process through which it is secured as upon the result itself.
author: Jane Addams

quote: Until they are of the age to use the brain.
author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

quote: Crime seems to change character when it crosses a bridge or a tunnel. In the city  crime is taken as emblematic of class and race. In the suburbs  though  it's intimate and psychological-resistant to generalization  a mystery of the individual soul.
author: Barbara Ehrenreich

quote: Since when do grown men and women  who presume to hold high government office and exercise what they think of as "moral leadership " require ethics officers to tell them whether it is or isn't permissible to grab the secretary's behind or redirect public funds to their own personal advantage?
author: Meg Greenfield

quote: Vice Is nice But a little virtue Won't hurt you.
author: Felicia Lamport

quote: The lesser evil is also evil.
author: Naomi Mitchison

quote: The great majority of successful business men and women have been and are possessors of strong personalities of the right sort  and by analyzing their climb to success it is amazing to discover how large a part good manners  good breeding  and correct behavior have had in helping them to win the goal.
author: Ida White Parker

quote: I don't eat junk food and I don't think junk thoughts.
author: Peace Pilgrim

quote: The Department of Justice is committed to asking one central question of everything we do: What is the right thing to do? Now that can produce debate  and I want it to be spirited debate. I want the lawyers of America to be able to call me and tell me: Janet  have you lost your mind?
author: Janet Reno

quote: The voice of conscience is so delicate that it is easy to stifle it  but it is also so clear that it is impossible to mistake it.
author: Madame de Stael

quote: Many people who wonder why they don't amount to more than they do have good stuff in them  and are energetic  persevering  and have ample opportunities. It is all a case of trimming the useless branches and throwing the whole force of power into the development of something that counts.
author: Walter J. Johnston

quote: Noble deeds and hot baths are the best cures for depression.
author: Dodie Smith

quote: Will you be satisfied with the fruit of your life's work? Will the efforts you are making now bring you satisfaction when the things of time are receding  and eternity looms ahead?
author: Raymond L. Cox

quote: The act of acting morally is behaving as if everything we do matters.
author: Gloria Steinem

quote: I place a high moral value on the way people behave. I find it repellent to have a lot  and to behave with anything other than courtesy in the old sense of the word-politeness of the heart  a gentleness of the spirit.
author: Emma Thompson

quote: Success ... depends on your ability to make and keep friends.
author: Sophie Tucker

quote: Some men succeed by what they know  some by what they do  and a few by what they are.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: Try not to become a man of success  but rather a man of value.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: It is abundantly clear that success tends to negate humility.
author: Landrum P. Leavell

quote: Success seems to be that which forms the distinction between confidence and conceit.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: The common idea that success spoils people by making them vain  egotistic  and self-complacent is erroneous  on the contrary  it makes them  for the most part  humble  tolerant  and kind. Failure makes people cruel and bitter.
author: W. Somerset Maugham

quote: Character cannot be developed in ease and quiet. Only through experience of trial and suffering can the soul be strengthened  vision cleared  ambition inspired  and success achieved.
author: Helen Keller

quote: If a man be self-controlled  truthful  wise  and resolute  is there aught that can stay out of reach of such a man?
author: The Panchatantra

quote: Character is the real foundation of all worthwhile success.
author: John Hays Hammond

quote: One of the first businesses of a sensible man is to know when he is beaten  and to leave off fighting at once.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: If you can't accept losing  you can't win.
author: Vince Lombardi

quote: You can't have any successes unless you can accept failure.
author: George Cukor

quote: We have fought this fight as long  and as well  as we know how. We have been defeated ... there is now but one course to pursue. We must accept the situation.
author: Robert E. Lee

quote: The most considerable difference I note among men is not in their readiness to fall into error  but in their readiness to acknowledge these inevitable lapses.
author: Thomas Henry Huxley

quote: An error gracefully acknowledged is a victory won.
author: Caroline L. Gascoigne

quote: The man who can own up to his error is greater than he who merely knows how to avoid making it.
author: Cardinal de Retz

quote: I have made mistakes  but I have never made the mistake of claiming that I never made one.
author: James Gordon Bennett

quote: I am not the smartest or most talented person in the world  but I succeeded because I keep going  and going  and going.
author: Sylvester Stallone

quote: Victory belongs to the most persevering.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: You can imprison a man  but not an idea. You can exile a man  but not an idea. You can kill a man  but not an idea.
author: Benazir Bhutto

quote: It never pays to deal with the flyweights of the world. They take far too much pleasure in thwarting you at every turn.
author: Sue Grafton

quote: I know the price of success: dedication  hard work and an unremitting devotion to the things you want to see happen.
author: Frank Lloyd Wright

quote: There is no point at which you can say  "Well  I'm successful now. I might as well take a nap."
author: Carrie Fisher

quote: I wrote for twelve years and collected 250 rejection slips before getting any fiction published  so I guess outside reinforcement isn't all that important to me.
author: Lisa Alther

quote: I used to want the words "She tried" on my tombstone. Now I want "She did it."
author: Katherine Dunham

quote: Success generally depends upon knowing how long it takes to succeed.
author: Charles de Montesquieu

quote: I am not afraid of the pen  or the scaffold  or the sword. I will tell the truth whenever I please.
author: Mother Jones

quote: Once I decide to do something  I can't have people telling me I can't. If there's a roadblock  you jump over it  walk around it  crawl under it.
author: Kitty Kelley

quote: Success seems to be largely a matter of hanging on after others have let go.
author: William Feather

quote: Call the roll in your memory of conspicuously successful business giants and ... you will be struck by the fact that almost every one of them encountered inordinate difficulties sufficient to crush all but the gamest of spirits. Edison went hungry many times before he became famous.
author: B. C. Forbes

quote: Problems arise in that one has to find a balance between what people need from you and what you need for yourself.
author: Jessye Norman

quote: If your efforts are sometimes greeted with indifference  don't lose heart. The sun puts on a wonderful show at daybreak  yet most of the people in the audience go on sleeping.
author: Ada Teixeira

quote: If you wish success in life  make perseverance your bosom friend.
author: Joseph Addison

quote: Perseverance is failing nineteen times and succeeding the twentieth.
author: Julie Andrews

quote: The only thing that happens overnight is recognition. Not talent.
author: Carol Haney

quote: If you rest  you rust.
author: Helen Hayes

quote: If you don't quit  and don't cheat  and don't run home when trouble arrives  you can only win.
author: Shelley Long

quote: They who are the most persistent  and work in the true spirit  will invariably be the most successful.
author: Samuel Smiles

quote: If at first you don't succeed  try  try  try again.
author: W. E. Hickson

quote: If at first you don't succeed  you're running about average.
author: M. H. Alderson

quote: The only way to the top is by persistent  intelligent  hard work.
author: A. T. Mercier

quote: The heights by great men reached and kept Were not attained by sudden flight  But they  while their companions slept Were toiling upward in the night.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: I realized early on that success was tied to not giving up. Most people in this business gave up and went on to other things. If you simply didn't give up  you would outlast the people who came in on the bus with you.
author: Harrison Ford

quote: Perseverance is a great element of success. If you only knock long enough and loud enough at the gate  you are sure to wake up somebody.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Four steps to achievement: plan purposefully  prepare prayerfully  proceed positively  pursue persistently.
author: William A. Ward

quote: The secret of success is constancy of purpose.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: I'm hardnosed about luck. I think it sucks. Yeah  if you spend seven years looking for a job as a copywriter  and then one day somebody gives you a job  you can say  "Gee  I was lucky I happened to go up there today." But dammit  I was going to go up there sooner or later in the next seventy years. ... If you're persistent in trying and doing and working  you almost make your own fortune.
author: Jerry Delia Femina

quote: Flaming enthusiasm  backed up by horse sense and persistence  is the quality that most frequently makes for success.
author: Dale Carnegie

quote: It's the plugging away that will win you the day So don't be a piker  old pard! Just draw on your grit  it's so easy to quit- It's the keeping your chin up that's hard.
author: Robert W. Service

quote: No one succeeds without effort.... Those who succeed owe their success to their perseverance.
author: Ramana Maharshi

quote: Big shots are only little shots who keep shooting.
author: Christopher Morley

quote: Entrepreneurs average 3.8 failures before final success. What sets the successful ones apart is their amazing persistence. There are a lot of people out there with good and marketable ideas  but pure entrepreneurial types almost never accept defeat.
author: Lisa M. Amos

quote: There are no shortcuts to any place worth going.
author: Beverly Sills

quote: Be of good cheer. Do not think of today's failures  but of the success that may come tomorrow. You have set yourselves a difficult task  but you will succeed if you persevere  and you will find a joy in overcoming obstacles. Remember  no effort that we make to attain something beautiful is ever lost.
author: Helen Keller

quote: The way to succeed is never quit. That's it. But really be humble about it. ... You start out lowly and humble and you carefully try to learn an accretion of little things that help you get there.
author: Alex Haley

quote: Continuous effort-not strength or intelligence-is the key to unlocking our potential.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Plodding wins the race.
author: Aesop

quote: The difficulties and struggles of today are but the price we must pay for the accomplishments and victories of tomorrow.
author: William J. H. Boetcker

quote: Let me tell you the secret that has led me to my goal. My strength lies solely in my tenacity.
author: Louis Pasteur

quote: A winner never quits  and a quitter never wins.
author: Anonymous

quote: It isn't hard to be good from time to time in sports. What's tough is being good every day.
author: Willie Mays

quote: If you start to take Vienna  take Vienna.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: There's such a thin line between winning and losing.
author: John R. Tunis

quote: Men who have attained things worth having in this world have worked while others idled  have persevered when others gave up in despair  have practiced early in life the valuable habits of self-denial  industry  and singleness of purpose. As a result  they enjoy in later life the success so often erroneously attributed to good luck.
author: Grenville Kleiser

quote: In the realm of ideas  everything depends on enthusiasm  in the real world  all rests on perseverance.
author: Johann von Goethe

quote: It takes time to be a success.
author: Anonymous

quote: Actually  I'm an overnight success. But it took twenty years.
author: Monty Hall

quote: It takes time to succeed because success is merely the natural reward for taking time to do anything well.
author: Joseph Ross

quote: Success generally depends upon knowing how long it takes to succeed.
author: Charles de Montesquieu

quote: It takes twenty years to make an overnight success.
author: Eddie Cantor

quote: Success is to be measured not so much by the position that one has reached in life as by the obstacles which he has overcome.
author: Booker T. Washington

quote: Our business in life is not to get ahead of others but to get ahead of ourselves-to break our own records  to outstrip our yesterdays by our today  to do our work with more force than ever before.
author: Steward B. Johnson

quote: Success has always been easy to measure. It is the distance between one's origins and one's final achievement.
author: Michael Korda

quote: How can they say my life is not a success? Have I not for more than sixty years got enough to eat and escaped being eaten?
author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quote: Survival is triumph enough.
author: Harry Crews

quote: Success is peace of mind  which is a direct result of knowing you did your best to become the best that you are capable of becoming.
author: John Wooden

quote: Success is relative: It is what we can make of the mess we have made of things.
author: T. S. Eliot

quote: The conventional army loses if it does not win. The guerrilla wins if he does not lose.
author: Henry Kissinger

quote: The man who has done his level best  and who is conscious that he has done his best  is a success  even though the world may write him down a failure.
author: B. C. Forbes

quote: My success is measured by my willingness to keep trying.
author: Anonymous

quote: If you've had a good time playing the game  you're a winner even if you lose.
author: Malcolm Forbes

quote: Success is living up to your potential. That's all. Wake up with a smile and go after life.... Live it  enjoy it  taste it  smell it  feel it.
author: Joe Knapp

quote: I have fought a good fight  I have finished my course  I have kept the faith.
author: Bible

quote: On earth we have nothing to do with success or results  but only with being true to God  and for God. Defeat in doing right is nevertheless victory.
author: Frederick W. Robertson

quote: The reward of a thing well done is to have done it.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: I'd rather be a lamppost in Chicago than a millionaire in any other city.
author: William A. Hulbert

quote: A successful man is he who receives a great deal from his fellow men  usually incomparably more than corresponds to his service to them. The value of a man  however  should be seen in what he gives  and not in what he is able to receive.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: There is only one success-to be able to spend your life in your own way.
author: Christopher Morley

quote: We only do well the things we like doing.
author: Colette

quote: The only success worth one's powder was success in the line of one's idiosyncrasy ... what was talent but the art of being completely whatever one happened to be?
author: Henry James

quote: Success based on anything but internal fulfillment is bound to be empty.
author: Dr. Martha Friedman

quote: All I would tell people is to hold on to what was individual about themselves  not to allow their ambition for success to cause them to try to imitate the success of others. You've got to find it on your own terms.
author: Harrison Ford

quote: For me  writing is the only thing that passes the three tests of metier: (1) when I'm doing it  I don't feel that I should be doing something else instead  (2.) it produces a sense of accomplishment and  once in a while  pride  and (3) it's frightening.
author: Gloria Steinem

quote: My mother said to me  "If you become a soldier  you'll be a general  if you become a monk you'll end up as the pope." Instead  I became a painter and wound up as Picasso.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: Abasement  degradation is simply the manner of life of the man who has refused to be what it is his duty to be.
author: Jose Ortega y Gasset

quote: Different people have different duties assigned to them by Nature  Nature has given one the power or the desire to do this  the other that. Each bird must sing with his own throat.
author: Henrik Ibsen

quote: A first rate soup is better than a second rate painting.
author: Abraham Maslow

quote: We can't all be heroes because someone has to sit on the curb and clap as they go by.
author: Will Rogers

quote: Nature magically suits a man to his fortunes  by making them the fruit of his character.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: I'd rather be a lamppost in Chicago than a millionaire in any other city.
author: William A. Hulbert

quote: We succeed in enterprises which demand the positive qualities we possess  but we excel in those which can also make use of our defects.
author: Alexis de Tocqueville

quote: A man can do only what he can do. But if he does that each day he can sleep at night and do it again the next day.
author: Albert Schweitzer

quote: Don't take anyone else's definition of success as your own. (This is easier said than done.)
author: Jacqueline Briskin

quote: Whatever you are by nature  keep to it  never desert your own line of talent. Be what nature intended you for  and you will succeed  be anything else and you will be ten thousand times worse than nothing.
author: Sydney Smith

quote: Ask yourself the secret of your success. Listen to your answer  and practice it.
author: Richard Bach

quote: I cannot do everything  but still I can do something  and because I cannot do everything I will not refuse to do something that I can do.
author: Edward Everett Hale

quote: Starting out to make money is the greatest mistake in life. Do what you feel you have a flair for doing  and if you are good enough at it  the money will come.
author: Greer Garson

quote: If a man has a talent and cannot use it  he has failed. If he has a talent and uses only half of it  he has partly failed. If he has a talent and learns somehow to use the whole of it  he has gloriously succeeded  and won a satisfaction and a triumph few men ever know.
author: Thomas Wolfe

quote: One can never consent to creep when one feels an impulse to soar.
author: Helen Keller

quote: Oh! Much may be done by defying The ghosts of Despair and Dismay And much may be gained by relying On "Where there's a Will There's a Way."
author: Eliza Cook

quote: We can never give up the belief that good guys always win. And that we are the good guys.
author: Faith Popcorn

quote: I know there will be spring  as surely as the birds know it when they see above the snow two tiny  quivering green leaves. Spring cannot fail us.
author: Olive Schreiner

quote: Most ball games are lost  not won.
author: Casey Stengel

quote: Never face facts  if you do you'll never get up in the morning.
author: Mario Thomas

quote: Before you can win a game  you have to not lose it.
author: Chuck Noll

quote: Football games aren't won  they're lost.
author: Fielding Yost

quote: Success is a journey  not a destination.
author: Ben Sweetland

quote: The journey is my home.
author: Muriel Rukeyser

quote: To travel hopefully is a better thing than to arrive  and the true success is to labor.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: The man who goes fishing gets something more than the fish he catches.
author: Mary Astor

quote: Despite the success cult  men are most deeply moved not by the reaching of the goal  but by the grandness of effort involved in getting there-or failing to get there.
author: Max Lerner

quote: To live only for some future goal is shallow. It's the sides of the mountain that sustain life  not the top.
author: Robert M. Pirsig

quote: The reward of the general is not a bigger tent  but command.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: It is good to have an end to journey toward  but it is the journey that matters  in the end.
author: Ursula K. LeGuin

quote: We're still not where we're going  but we're not where we were.
author: Natash Jasefowitz

quote: 'Tis the motive exalts the action  'Tis the doing  and not the deed.
author: Margaret Junkin Preston

quote: Arriving at one goal is the starting point to another.
author: John Dewey

quote: I think that wherever your journey takes you  there are new gods waiting there  with divine patience-and laughter.
author: Susan M. Watkins

quote: It has never been  and never will be  easy work! But the road that is built in hope is more pleasant to the traveler than the road built in despair  even though they both lead to the same destination.
author: Marion Zimmer Bradley

quote: In the long run  the pessimist may be proved to be right  but the optimist has a better time on the trip.
author: Daniel L. Reardon

quote: The excursion is the same when you go looking for your sorrow as when you go looking for your joy.
author: Eudora Welty

quote: The reward of a thing well done is to have done it.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: The struggle alone pleases us  not the victory.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: The problem is not that you cannot have what you think you want. The problem is that when you get what you think you want  it won't satisfy.
author: Anonymous

quote: We should scarcely desire things ardently if we were perfectly acquainted with what we desire.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quote: With the catching ends the pleasures of the chase.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: To have realized your dream makes you feel lost.
author: Oriana Fallaci

quote: Need and struggle are what excite and inspire us  our hour of triumph is what brings the void.
author: William James

quote: We spend our time searching for security  and hate it when we get it.
author: John Steinbeck

quote: Happiness is not a station to arrive at  but a manner of traveling.
author: Margaret Lee Runbeck

quote: Happiness is to be found along the way  not at the end of the road  for then the journey is over and it is too late.
author: Robert R. Updegraff

quote: The really happy man is one who can enjoy the scenery on a detour.
author: Anonymous

quote: You wear yourself out in the pursuit of wealth or love or freedom  you do everything to gain some right  and once it's gained you take no pleasure in it.
author: Oriana Fallaci

quote: Success is counted sweetest by those who ne'er succeed.
author: Emily Dickinson
